</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1759, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 13 Rabi' al-Akhir 1447 AH - 5/10/2025
</header>

Article (Fifteen) of the Law stipulated that the competent authority may participate in industrial projects or cities with capital or in-kind shares, provided that this does not conflict with the regulations and legislation in force in the Council states.
Article (Sixteen) clarified that the project owner may be obliged to provide a valid insurance policy covering liability for anticipated damages, issued by one of the licensed insurance companies in accordance with what is customary in each of the Council states.
Article (Seventeen) of the Law also stipulated that industrial projects shall be subject to the supervision and control of the competent authority in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Executive Regulations.
Article (Eighteen) provided for the possibility of granting judicial enforcement powers to employees of the competent authority to implement the provisions of this System (Law) and its Executive Regulations, in accordance with the procedures followed in the Council states.
Article (Nineteen) entrusted the competent employees with the right to enter the sites of industrial projects, their offices and branches, inspect their books and documents, take samples of their products and examine them, and draw up a report of any violation of the provisions of this System (Law) and its Executive Regulations.
Article (Twenty) also stipulated that specialists authorized to inspect the books and records of industrial projects by virtue of the provisions of this System (Law) must maintain the confidentiality of this information and not disclose it except to the competent authority. In case of violation, the offender shall be punished according to the regulations of each of the Council states.
The Law dedicated the articles contained in Chapter Five to administrative penalties. Article (Twenty-One) clarified that, without prejudice to criminal and civil liability, the competent authority may issue a reasoned decision to apply any of the administrative penalties to industrial projects violating the provisions of this System (Law) or its Executive Regulations, by imposing a warning penalty to remove the causes of the violation within a period not exceeding thirty days, or temporarily suspending the industrial project for a period not exceeding ninety days, or imposing a daily administrative fine to compel the violator to
cease the violation and remove its causes and effects, or imposing a total administrative fine, or closing the industrial project, or revoking the industrial license.
Each of the Council states shall undertake to determine the minimum and maximum limits for administrative fines and total fines, in accordance with the procedures and systems followed therein. The collection of the administrative fine shall be by the methods prescribed for collecting due amounts in each state. When imposing administrative penalties on an industrial project violating the provisions of this System (Law) and its Executive Regulations, their proportionality to the gravity of the violation, the benefits gained by the project, and the damage caused to others as a result thereof shall be taken into account.
The Law dedicated the articles contained in Chapter Six to the systems of decisions issued in application of the provisions of this Law. Article (Twenty-Two) clarified that those affected by these decisions may appeal to the competent authority in accordance with the systems followed in each of the Council states.
And allocated the fees due according to the provisions of this System (Law) and its Executive Regulations in accordance with the procedures prescribed in each state.
The Law clarified in the articles contained in Chapter Seven what pertains to regularization of status. Article (Twenty-Four) clarified that every project owner who obtained an industrial license before the entry into force of this System (Law) shall regularize their status under this System (Law) and its Executive Regulations within one year from the date of its entry into force.
Article (Twenty-Five) of this Law also stipulated that the Executive Regulations shall be issued in accordance with the procedures followed in each state after their approval by the Ministerial Committee. The same procedures stipulated in this article shall apply to their amendments. The head of the competent authority may issue the necessary decisions to facilitate the industrial sector and manage its activities, provided that this does not conflict with the provisions of this System (Law) and its Executive Regulations.
Article (Twenty-Six) of the Law provided for the repeal of the Unified Industrial Organization System (Law) for the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, which was established by the decision of the Supreme Council in its twenty-fifth session in 2004.
Article (Twenty-Seven) clarified that the Ministerial Committee may propose amendments to this System (Law), and the procedures stipulated in Article (28) of this System (Law) shall apply to its enforcement.
The Law concluded its provisions with Article (Twenty-Eight), which stipulated that this System (Law) shall be approved by the Supreme Council and shall be implemented as mandatory in accordance with the constitutional procedures of each state.

1.  **The Supreme Council**: The Supreme Council of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.
2.  **Member States**: The member states of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.
3.  **Ministerial Committee**: The committee specialized in industrial affairs.
4.  **The System (Law)**: The Unified Industrial Regulation System (Law) for the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.
5.  **The Regulation**: The executive regulation of this System (Law).
6.  **Competent Authority**: The ministry, authority, or any body concerned with industrial affairs in any of the Member States.
7.  **Head of the Competent Authority**: The minister or the head of the authority or body concerned with industrial affairs.
8.  **Department**: The department concerned with industrial affairs within the Competent Authority.
9.  **Industrial Project**: Any economic activity whose primary purpose is the total or partial manufacturing of products by converting primary raw materials or materials that have undergone previous transformations into manufactured or intermediate products, or by converting semi-manufactured or intermediate products into fully manufactured products, including sorting, separation, shaping, reshaping, assembly, and packaging, provided that most or some of these operations are carried out using machinery. It also includes craft industries and manual industries.
10. **Industrial Establishment**: Any location where a licensed industrial project is carried out.
11. **Knowledge-Based Industries**: Industrial projects that rely on the intensive use of technology, intellectual capital, skills, and technical know-how in research and development, innovation, and technology capable of being used in production processes, aiming to improve products, productivity, manufacturing processes, business models, and the production of new products.

### Article Three
#### Scope of Application
The provisions of this Regulation (Law) shall apply to every industrial project in the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries, with the exception of the following:
1. Projects specified by the Executive Regulations.
2. Projects governed by international treaties or agreements.
3. Projects governed by special provisions in each of the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries.

### Article Three
#### Objectives of the Regulation (Law)
This Regulation (Law) aims to achieve the following:
1. Regulating the industrial sector, promoting industrial development, encouraging industrial investment, increasing the industrial sector's contribution to the national income, expanding industrial activity, and integrating economic activities among the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries.
2. Implementing the economic policies of the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries, including manufacturing, and contributing to meeting the requirements of economic development plans and programs.
3. Supporting cooperation, integration, and coordination among the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries, and advancing industry.
4. Stimulating innovation, adopting advanced technology, and localizing it in the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries to upgrade the industrial sector and enhance its competitiveness.
5. Enhancing policies related to qualified national workforce in the industrial sector in accordance with the regulations (laws) followed in the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries.
6. Encouraging the digital transformation of industrial projects in the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries and motivating them to update and develop manufacturing technologies, keep pace with the Fourth Industrial Revolution, and utilize its technologies and innovations, including knowledge-based industries and environmental industries.
7. Encouraging the use of energy-efficient machinery and equipment in manufacturing processes.
8. Adhering to environmental security, health, and safety standards in accordance with the regulations (laws) followed in the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries.
9. Adhering to public order, customs, and traditions observed in the GCC <orig>دول المجلس</orig> countries.

## Industrial Licensing

### Article Four
#### Requirement for Obtaining an Industrial License
It is not permissible to establish an industrial project, or change its production, nature, or develop it, or merge it with another, or divide it, or change its location, or dispose of it wholly or partially, except based on an industrial license issued in accordance with the provisions of this Regulation (Law).

### Article Five
#### Procedures for Obtaining an Industrial License
1. To apply for an industrial license, an initial approval for the industrial project must be obtained from the Department <orig>الإدارة</orig>, in accordance with what the Bylaw <orig>اللائحة</orig> specifies. The initial approval shall be valid for one year, renewable as deemed appropriate by the competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig>.
2. The industrial license application shall be submitted to the Department <orig>الإدارة</orig> on the prepared forms, fulfilling all required data, documents, and studies as specified by the Bylaw <orig>اللائحة</orig>. If the Department <orig>الإدارة</orig> deems it necessary to provide any additional information, the applicant must be notified thereof. If such information is not submitted within one week from the date of notification, the application shall be considered null and void.
3. The Department <orig>الإدارة</orig> shall decide on the application within a maximum period of thirty days from the date of its complete submission. The applicant shall be notified of the decision within a period not exceeding seven days from the issuance of the decision. If the decision rejects the application, it must be reasoned. The expiry of the decision period for a complete application without a response shall be considered an implicit rejection. Anyone whose application is rejected, whether explicitly or implicitly, may appeal the decision in accordance with the provisions of Article Twenty-Two of this Regulation (Law) <orig>النظام (القانون)</orig>.
4. The Department <orig>الإدارة</orig> shall issue the industrial license in accordance with Form 1 and the annex attached to the Bylaw <orig>اللائحة</orig>. The license shall specify the timeframe for commencing production.

### Article Six
#### Cases for Revoking an Industrial License
The competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> may revoke the initial approval or the industrial license in any of the following cases:
a. Upon the request of the project owner.

3. Failure to implement the industrial project or cessation of its completion within the specified period for commencing production.
4. If it is proven that the industrial license was obtained based on incorrect data.
5. Failure to implement the industrial project according to the information upon which the license was granted.
6. If the competent authority determines that the industrial project fails to meet the conditions and criteria upon which the industrial license was granted.
7. If the industrial project ceases production for a period exceeding one year without obtaining the approval of the competent authority.

## Article Seven
### Obligations of Industrial Project Owners

The project owner is obligated to the following:
1. Commence and continue the operations of the industrial project for which advantages and exemptions were granted, in accordance with the specified conditions.
2. Not to assign or transfer the advantages and exemptions in any way to another person without obtaining prior approval from the competent authority.
3. Provide the data requested by the competent authority regarding the establishment and the industrial project in full.
4. Use the production inputs covered by the advantages or exemption, or the compound, for the purposes for which they were exempted throughout the duration of the licensed industrial project, and to maintain a record of these inputs.
5. Notify the Administration within thirty days from the date the industrial project ceases operation, wholly or partially, stating the reasons for such cessation.
6. Renew the registration certificate in the Industrial Register.
7. Submit annually to the Administration the information specified by the regulations, according to the prepared forms.
8. Adhere to the conformity of the industrial project's products with approved national or GCC <orig>الخليجية</orig> standard specifications, and exert all possible efforts to apply the specifications in force in international markets.

### Chapter Three
### The Industrial Register

### Article Eight
#### Establishment of the Industrial Register
An industrial register shall be established within the Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig>. The Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة</orig> shall specify the conditions and procedures for registration in the Industrial Register <orig>السجل الصناعي</orig>.

### Article Nine
#### Registration in the Industrial Register
The project owner <orig>صاحب المشروع</orig> must submit an application to the Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig> for the registration of their project in the Industrial Register <orig>السجل الصناعي</orig> within sixty days from the date of actual production commencement.
The Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة</orig> shall specify the data of the Industrial Register certificate <orig>شهادة القيد في السجل الصناعي</orig>, its procedures, method of acquisition, and uses.
The Industrial Register certificate <orig>شهادة القيد في السجل الصناعي</orig> shall be renewed annually in accordance with the regulations of each of the Council states.

### Article Ten
#### Industrial Project Data
The project owner <orig>صاحب المشروع</orig>, their heirs, or the assignee, as the case may be, may obtain an extract of their industrial project data registered in the Industrial Register <orig>السجل الصناعي</orig>, in accordance with the procedures specified by the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة</orig>.

### Article Eleven
#### Publication of Information, Data, and Statistics
Information, data, and statistics related to projects registered in the Industrial Register <orig>السجل الصناعي</orig> shall be published in accordance with what is specified by the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة</orig>.

### Article Twelve
#### Prohibition of Detailed Information Circulation
Information and data registered in the Industrial Register <orig>السجل الصناعي</orig> and declared by the industrial project owner <orig>صاحب المشروع الصناعي</orig> as confidential and unauthorized, shall not be circulated or used except in accordance with the conditions stipulated in this Law <orig>النظام (القانون)</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>.

# Chapter Four
## Powers of the Competent Authority

### Article Thirteen
### Industrial Development Committee
By a decision of the head of the Competent Authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig>, one or more technical committees <orig>لجنة فنية</orig> may be established, specialized in regulating, developing, and promoting industry. It may seek assistance from experts and technicians <orig>ذوي الاختصاص من الخبراء والفنيين</orig>. The decision shall specify its working system and how its decisions are made, provided it does not conflict with the provisions of this Law <orig>النظام (القانون)</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته</orig>.

### Article Fourteen
### Exemptions and Benefits
Imports of all industrial projects established in the GCC states shall be exempt from taxes (customs duties) necessary for commencing industrial production, in accordance with the controls. Industrial inputs shall be exempt from taxes (customs duties) agreed upon within the framework of the GCC states.
The competent authority may grant the industrial establishment a set of appropriate encouraging advantages and incentives in accordance with the regulations of each state, and in a manner that does not conflict with the obligations of the GCC states to the World Trade Organization <orig>منظمة التجارة العالمية</orig>.

### Article Fifteen
### Participation in Industrial Projects
The competent authority shall support participation in industrial projects or industrial cities with capital or in-kind shares, provided that this does not conflict with the systems and legislations in force in the GCC states.

### Article Sixteen
### Insurance Against Damages
The project owner must be obliged to provide a valid insurance policy covering liability for anticipated damages, issued by one of the licensed insurance companies, in accordance with what is in force in each of the GCC states.

### Article Eighteen
Judicial Enforcement Power
Employees of the competent authority may be granted judicial enforcement power to implement the provisions of this System (Law) and its Bylaw, in accordance with the procedures followed in the GCC states.

### Article Nineteen
Entry to Sites and Access to Documents
Competent employees shall have the right to enter the sites of industrial projects, their residences, and their branches, to inspect their books and documents, take samples of their products and examine them, and to draw up a report on any violation of the provisions of this System (Law) and its Bylaw.

### Article Twenty
Confidentiality of Information
Those authorized to inspect the books and records of industrial projects pursuant to the provisions of this System (Law) must maintain the confidentiality of this information and not disclose it except to a competent authority. In case of violation, the offender shall be punished according to the regulations of each GCC state.

## Chapter Five
Administrative Penalties

### Article Twenty-One
A. Without prejudice to criminal and civil liability, the competent authority may issue a reasoned decision imposing any of the following administrative penalties on industrial projects that violate the provisions of this System (Law) or its Bylaw:
- A. A warning to remove the causes of the violation within a period not exceeding thirty days.
- B. Temporary suspension of the industrial project for a period not exceeding ninety days.

(Unified Industrial Regulation Law - Adopted in the 43rd Session of the Supreme Council)

Chapter Six
Article Twenty-One
Grievance
Any party affected by decisions issued in application of the provisions of this System (Law) may file a grievance with the competent committee in accordance with the regulations followed in each member state of the Council.

Article Twenty-Two
Service Fees
The head of the competent authority shall issue the fees due in accordance with the provisions of this System (Law) and its regulations, and in accordance with the procedures prescribed in each state.

Chapter Seven
Concluding Provisions
Article Twenty-Four
Regularization of Status
Every project owner who obtained an industrial license before the implementation of this System (Law) must regularize their status in accordance with this System (Law) and its regulations within one year from the date its provisions come into effect.

The head of the competent authority may issue the necessary decisions to regulate the industrial sector and manage its activities, provided that they do not conflict with the provisions of this System (Law) and its executive regulations.

### Article Twenty-Six
#### Repeal
The Unified Industrial Regulation System (Law) <orig>نظام (قانون) التنظيم الصناعي الموحد لدول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> for the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> States, stipulated by the Supreme Council's decision in its twenty-fifth session of 2004, is hereby repealed.

### Article Twenty-Eight

## Decree No. 190 of 2025
### Approving a Memorandum of Understanding
Between the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
And the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan <orig>جمهورية طاجيكستان</orig>
In the Field of Commercial Cooperation

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Approval is hereby given to the Memorandum of Understanding <orig>مذكرة تفاهم</orig> between the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan <orig>جمهورية طاجيكستان</orig> in the field of commercial cooperation, signed in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> on 3/11/2024, the texts of which are attached to this Decree.

### Article Two
The Prime Minister <orig>وزير الوزراء</orig> - each within their respective jurisdiction - shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1759, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 13 Rabi' al-Akhir 1447 AH - 5/10/2025 AD
</header>

Based on the strong desire to strengthen the existing friendly relations and cooperation between them.
Insisting on contributing through commercial cooperation and achieving further prosperity for their peoples.
And desiring to enhance commercial cooperation between them.
They have agreed as follows:

## 1. Objectives
This Memorandum of Understanding contains the following objectives:
1- Improving economic relations in the fields of trade and investment.
2- Enhancing cooperation with the aim of liberalizing trade and investment between the two parties in accordance with their respective laws and international obligations.
3- Facilitating increased private sector participation in commercial and investment cooperation.
4- Developing a suitable environment and complementary activities to encourage private sector investment between the two parties.
5- Ensuring the continuous flow of goods in cases of crises and disasters.
3- Encouraging and supporting trade development activities such as (seminars, workshops, commercial and industrial exhibitions), missions, field visits, and marketing studies.
4- Identifying sectors of importance that would help support trade and investment flows between Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> and Tajikistan <orig>طاجيكستان</orig>.
5- Cooperation between official institutions responsible for commercial, economic, and investment cooperation.
6- Exchanging commercial information at regional and global levels in the field of goods and services.

## 2. Implementation Mechanism
1- The two parties shall establish a Joint Sub-Committee for Commercial Cooperation <orig>لجنة فرعية مشتركة للتعاون التجاري</orig> stemming from the Main Committee <orig>اللجنة الرئيسية</orig>. This committee shall consist of representatives from the ministries and departments concerned with trade for both parties.
2- The committee's sessions shall be held upon the request of either party.
3- The committee shall strive to develop and enhance cooperation in the commercial and investment fields.
4- The committee may decide to establish working groups on specific areas of cooperation.

## 3. Joint Committee
In order to encourage the development of commercial relations between Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> and Tajikistan <orig>طاجيكستان</orig>, the committee shall carry out the following activities:
1- Regular exchange of information on commercial and investment opportunities in both countries.
2- Encouraging commercial meetings and other complementary activities that lead to the expansion of trade and investment relations between the private sectors in both countries.

## 4. Legal Status
This Memorandum of Understanding <orig>مذكرة التفاهم</orig> is considered legally non-binding and does not create any right or obligation under international law.

## 5. Dispute Resolution
Any dispute that may arise between the parties concerning the implementation and interpretation of this Memorandum of Understanding <orig>مذكرة التفاهم</orig> shall be settled through consultation and negotiation via diplomatic channels.

## 6. Entry into Force, Extension, Termination
1- This Memorandum of Understanding <orig>مذكرة التفاهم</orig> shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last notification by which one party informs the other in writing and through diplomatic channels of the completion of the necessary internal procedures for its entry into force.
2- This Memorandum of Understanding <orig>مذكرة التفاهم</orig> may be amended by mutual consent of the parties, and the amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the preceding paragraph.
3- This Memorandum of Understanding <orig>مذكرة التفاهم</orig> shall be effective from the date of its signing between the parties and shall remain in force for a period of five years, provided that it remains effective until one party notifies the other of its desire to terminate it by prior written notice through diplomatic channels. It shall be automatically renewed unless one party notifies the other of its desire to terminate it three months prior to the expiration date.

Done in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> on November 3, 2024, in two original copies in Arabic, Tajik, and English languages. All texts being equally authentic. In case of divergence in interpretation, the English text shall prevail.

For the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan <orig>جمهورية طاجيكستان</orig>
Zavqi Zavqizoda <orig>زوقي زوقي زاده</orig>
Minister of Economic Development and Trade

For the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Dhahi Al-Askar <orig>خليفة عبدالله ضاحي العسكر</orig>
Minister of Commerce and Industry

 Legal Status

This MoU is not legally binding and does not establish any rights and obligations under international law.

### 5. settlements of Disputes

The Parties will settle any dispute in interpretation or application of this MoU by consultation and negotiation through diplomatic channels.

### 6. Entry into force, renewal and termination

1.  This MoU shall enter into force from the date of the last notification whereby one of the Contracting Parties informs the other in writing through the diplomatic channels that it has satisfied the constitutional or legal procedures required for its entry into force.
2.  This MoU may be amended by mutual consent and the intervention of this amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures mentioned in the previous paragraph.
3.  This MoU will be in effective from the date of its signature between the Parties and shall remain in force for a period of (5) five years and shall remain in force until one of the Parties notifies the other Party of its intention to terminate it by prior written notice through diplomatic channels, and must be automatically renewed unless one of the Parties notifies the other of its desire to terminate it (3) three months before the expiry date.

### Article Two
The ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this decree, which shall come into effect from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

# Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan
## In the Field of Trade Facilitation

The Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan (hereinafter referred to as "the Contracting Parties").
Desiring to develop trade relations between the two countries on the basis of equality and mutual benefit.
Convinced of the importance of developing and increasing the exchange of goods and services.
Have agreed as follows:

### Article 1
The Contracting Parties shall take all necessary measures to expand and diversify the exchange of goods and services between the two countries, in accordance with this Memorandum (hereinafter referred to as "the Memorandum").

### Article 2
The Contracting Parties shall encourage the conclusion of contracts between natural and legal persons in the State of Kuwait and the Republic of Uzbekistan, provided that these persons have obtained the necessary permits to engage in foreign trade in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in both countries.

### Article 3
The Contracting Parties shall provide the necessary facilities for the participation of the other Party in trade fairs and international markets, which are held in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in both countries.

### Article 4
The Contracting Parties shall encourage the exchange of trade delegations between the two countries with the aim of strengthening bilateral trade relations, in line with the laws and regulations in force in both countries.

### Article 5
Within the framework of this Memorandum, all payments related to goods and services between the two countries shall be made using freely convertible currencies, based on a mutual agreement between the Contracting Parties.

### Article 6
The Contracting Parties shall, by mutual consent, provide the following facilities in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in both countries:
1. Allowing the free movement of goods from the territory of one Party to the territory of a third country.
2. Allowing the free movement of goods from the territory of a third country to the territory of the other Party.

### Article 7
The Parties shall be temporarily exempted from customs duties and taxes, in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in both countries, for the following goods:

Amir of Kuwait

Deputy Prime Minister

samples that bear no commercial value and are intended solely for receiving orders for this type of goods, provided they are unfit for use for any other purpose (maximum two copies per type).
2. Goods of commercial value intended for display at exhibitions, markets, international meetings, and other similar events (excluding exhibitions held at production sites for the purpose of selling imported goods or achieving other commercial objectives), in addition to the equipment and auxiliary materials necessary for these events.

### Article 8
1. The Contracting Parties shall endeavor to facilitate e-commerce flows for the other Party in their territories.
2. The Contracting Parties shall encourage cooperation between institutions operating in the field of e-commerce within their territories, including supporting the integration of small and medium-sized enterprises into the cross-border digital trade system.
3. The Contracting Parties shall cooperate to remove barriers hindering e-commerce and work to establish suitable infrastructure and conditions to promote cross-border digital trade.

### Article 9
The Contracting Parties shall establish a Trade Facilitation Working Group composed of their representatives, whose tasks shall be as follows:
1. Monitoring the implementation of the provisions of this Memorandum.
2. Evaluating bilateral trade.
3. Discussing proposals submitted by one of the Parties to expand or diversify trade between the two countries.
4. Implementing measures to simplify procedures and technical requirements in goods trade.
5. Simplifying customs operations and border regulation, and exploring opportunities for using digital technologies in customs control and customs clearance.
6. Considering the possibility of mutual recognition of conformity assessment certificates issued by the competent authorities of the Parties.
The Working Group shall meet for consultations in Kuwait City and Tashkent, upon the request of one of the Contracting Parties and by agreement with the other Party.

### Article 10
This Memorandum of Understanding is not an agreement subject to international law and is concluded without prejudice to the national laws and legislations of both Parties.

### Article 11
The provisions of this Memorandum shall continue to apply to contracts concluded during its period of validity and not yet established after the termination date of this Memorandum.
Any dispute that may arise between the Contracting Parties regarding the interpretation or application of this Memorandum shall be settled amicably through consultations or negotiations between the Contracting Parties via diplomatic channels.

### Article 12
This Memorandum shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last written notification by which one of the Contracting Parties informs the other Party, through diplomatic channels, of the completion of its internal legal procedures. This Memorandum shall remain valid for a period of five years from the date of receipt of the second notification.
Should one of the Contracting Parties not receive a written notification from the other Party through diplomatic channels expressing the desire to terminate this Memorandum 6 months prior to its expiry date, the validity of this Memorandum shall be automatically extended for successive similar periods.
This Memorandum may be amended at any time by mutual written consent between the Contracting Parties through diplomatic channels, and the amendments shall become effective in accordance with the provisions contained in the first paragraph of this Article.
Signed in Tashkent on November 21, 2024, in two original copies in Arabic, English, and Uzbek languages, all texts being equally authentic. In case of any discrepancy, the English text shall prevail.

# Decree No. 193 of 2025
## Regarding Judicial Promotions

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And upon the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
*   And upon Decree-Law No. 14 of 1977 regarding the grades and salaries of judges, members of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>, and the Department of Fatwa and Legislation <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>, and its amending laws,
*   And upon the Law Regulating the Judiciary <orig>قانون تنظيم القضاء</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. 23 of 1990, and its amending laws,
*   And upon Decree No. 57 of 1990 regarding the salaries and allowances of judges, members of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>, and the Department of Fatwa and Legislation <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>, and its amending decrees,

2- Preparing and training all members of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>, members of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>, and employees of the General Department of Investigations <orig>الإدارة العامة للتحقيقات</orig> who are Kuwaiti, practically and applicably, to perform their work and enhance their expertise to raise the level of their performance and practical application.
3- Forming and training judicial assistants and their aides on legal procedures, raising the level of their practical performance, following up on their qualification, and developing their knowledge and competencies.
4- Holding special courses for employees of legal and other entities within state agencies, public bodies, and institutions.
5- Holding special courses for employees of legal and other entities within the private sector.
6- Collecting, preserving, and publishing judicial documents and legal research.
7- Developing and deepening scientific research in legal, judicial, and jurisprudential fields, including organizing seminars and meetings. The Institute <orig>المعهد</orig> may issue a periodic journal for publishing peer-reviewed research and studies.
The Institute <orig>المعهد</orig> may undertake the training and qualification of members of judicial and legal bodies and their assisting entities in Islamic, Arab, and other countries, and exchange expertise and activities with similar institutes in these countries.
Furthermore, the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig>, with the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may organize foundational or preparatory courses aimed at Kuwaiti graduates of law faculties or their equivalents.

### Article (5)
The Institute's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة المعهد</orig> is the dominant authority over its affairs and the achievement of its objectives, and it is specialized in the following:
1- Setting the general policy of the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig> and overseeing its implementation.
2- Approving the Institute's <orig>المعهد</orig> activities at the beginning of each year, endorsing training, study, and research programs, determining their dates, distributing their tasks, and forming their committees.
3- Drawing the organizational structure of the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig> and its departments, defining competencies, and establishing the internal work system.
4- Establishing the necessary controls and standards for courses held by the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig> for governmental and private entities, and graduates of law faculties or their equivalents.
5- Approving the results of passing courses, seminars, and competitions held by the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig>.
6- Forming technical committees from among its members or others to propose programs and studies specific to the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig> and other matters assigned to it.
7- Selecting members of the training staff and technical supervisors, provided that a decision for their secondment is issued by the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>.
8- Determining the remunerations for training staff members and incentives granted to those in charge of the Institute's <orig>المعهد</orig> affairs and researchers, in accordance with the applicable systems and regulations.
9- Discussing the annual report submitted on the progress of work and activities of the Institute <orig>المعهد</orig>.
10- Approving the estimates prepared for the Institute's <orig>المعهد</orig> revenues, expenditures, and final account before submitting them to the competent authorities.

### Article Two
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers <orig>الوزراء</orig> - each within their respective jurisdiction - shall implement this Decree, which shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into effect from the date of its publication.

- And based on the provisions of Law No. (70) of 2020 regarding the practice of medicine and its allied professions, patient rights, and health facilities.
- And based on Ministerial Resolution No. (356) of 1995 regarding the job description for physicians at the Ministry and the additional conditions required for filling and promotion to these positions.
- And based on Ministerial Resolution No. (57) of 2022 regarding the implementation of policies and procedures for obtaining informed patient consent.
- And based on Ministerial Resolution No. (209) of 2022 for the Code of Ethical Conduct for practitioners of medicine and its allied professions, students, and trainees.
- And based on Ministerial Resolution No. (71) of 2024 regarding the general conditions and controls for licensing the practice of the profession in the governmental sector and the private medical sector.
- And based on the exigencies of work interest.
### - Has Decided -
### Article One
Home healthcare services for children mean: healthcare services provided at the home of the healthcare service recipient by a specialized national healthcare team for specific categories of patients in cooperation with their families. These categories include patients with chronic diseases, cancer patients, and other cases requiring home healthcare for children, provided that the patient is assessed by a physician from the home healthcare service team to receive treatment according to the specific policies and procedures for such care.
### Article Two
Practitioners shall adhere to the medical controls and guidelines for providing home healthcare services for children issued by the Council of Pediatric Departments <orig>مجلس أقسام الأطفال</orig> and its amendments.
### Article Three
When providing home healthcare services for children by licensed practitioners, the following must be adhered to:
- Adhering to the rules, regulations, and procedures governing the practice of the profession according to the job title stated in the medical license and area of specialization.
- Ensuring the recording and documentation of data and the health status of the healthcare service recipient in the medical file.
- Following the necessary procedures to obtain the consent of the guardian <orig>ولي النفس</orig>, mother, custodian, or legal representative for providing home healthcare services through an informed consent form before any health or medical service or procedure is performed.
### Article Four
This Resolution shall be communicated to those concerned for its implementation, shall be effective from its date of issuance, shall supersede any resolution or text that contradicts its provisions, and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (86) of 2025
Regarding the Rules, Conditions, and Procedures for the Transfer of Possession of Rest Houses (Chalets - Land Plots) from the Deceased to the Heirs

The Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig> and Acting Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment <orig>وزير الدولة للشؤون الاقتصادية الاستثمار بالوكالة</orig>,
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (18) of 1969 <orig>القانون رقم (18) لسنة 1969</orig> regarding the demarcation of state lands outside the general organizational plan and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. (105) of 1980 <orig>المرسوم بالقانون رقم (105) لسنة 1980</orig> regarding the state property system, and its amending laws,
- And Cabinet Decision No. (31) of 1982 <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء رقم (31) لسنة 1982</orig> regarding licensing the exploitation of state lands outside the general organizational plan and its amending decisions,
- And Cabinet Decision No. (1155) of 2025 <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء رقم (1155) لسنة 2025</orig> amending item third of Article Two bis of Cabinet Decision No. (31/82) <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء رقم (31/82)</orig> regarding licensing the exploitation of state lands outside the general organizational plan,
- And based on the recommendation of the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>,
- And based on the exigencies of work interest.
Has decided:
### Article One
First: The rules and conditions followed by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> for the exploitation of rest houses (land plots or chalets) shall be applied, whereby the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> may directly conclude an exploitation contract with the heirs for the same activity, which is a family rest house.
Second: The majority of heirs exploiting rest houses (land plots or chalets) are permitted to submit an application to the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> for the subdivision of the rest house, accompanied by an engineering plan approved by the majority of heirs and issued by an engineering office, in accordance with the controls and conditions approved by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>. The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> shall notify the remaining heirs of the subdivision request in accordance with legally prescribed procedures, granting them a two-week period to respond to the subdivision request.
Third: Procedures to be followed after the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> notifies the remaining heirs of the subdivision request:
a- In case all heirs agree to the subdivision request, the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> shall complete the necessary technical and administrative procedures.
b- In case all heirs do not agree to the subdivision request, the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> shall notify all heirs in accordance with legally prescribed procedures and grant them a two-week period to find a consensual solution among themselves. If no consensual solution is reached among all heirs, the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> shall refer the request and the engineering plan submitted by the majority of heirs to the Subdivision Committee <orig>لجنة الفرز</orig> to complete the necessary technical and administrative procedures.
Fourth: The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> shall refer the subdivision request to Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> to inspect the rest house (land plot), to approve the plan and provide a technical opinion regarding the subdivision process.
Fifth: A committee called the (Subdivision Committee <orig>لجنة الفرز</orig>) shall be formed by a decision of the Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig>. The decision shall specify the number of its members, its competencies, and its work system. Decisions issued by the committee shall be considered final.
Sixth: The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> shall address all heirs after the issuance of the subdivision decision to pay the subdivision fees and usufruct consideration, and to sign the new licenses for the rest houses (land plots or chalets) and to identify and receive each site. All heirs shall be granted a two-month period for payment and signing the new licenses. If any heir fails to pay or sign, their license shall be cancelled, and the subdivided area allocated to them from the rest house shall be withdrawn.
### Article Two
The competent authorities – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The Minister of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزير الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>, the Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig>, and Acting Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment <orig>وزير الدولة للشؤون الاقتصادية والاستثمار بالوكالة</orig>
Dr. Sabeeh Abdulaziz Al-Mukhaizeem <orig>د. صبيح عبدالعزيز المخيزيم</orig>
Issued on: 30 September 2025 AD

## Article Two
The following conditions are required for eligibility to disburse plant support:
-1 Adherence to all laws, regulations, and decisions regulating the practice of local plant production activity.
-2 In the event of waiving the right of usufruct <orig>حق الانتفاع</orig> over the holding, support shall be disbursed in light of the concluded contract and according to the agricultural periods.
-3 Plant production holdings must be located in one of the agricultural areas (Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> – Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig> – Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig>).
-4 Plant holdings for which the plant support value is less than (100) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall not receive support.
-5 Holdings with more than one partner shall not receive plant support unless a form is signed authorizing one of the partners to disburse the support on behalf of all of them.

### Article Three
Plant production support shall be disbursed over (4) agricultural periods during the fiscal year as follows:
- First Period: From April 1st until the end of June.
- Second Period: From July 1st until the end of September.
- Third Period: From October 1st until the end of December.
- Fourth Period: From January 1st until the end of March.
Support shall be disbursed to farmers for marketed produce of the varieties specified in the table in Article One during each agricultural period, in accordance with the established controls.

### Article Four
Support shall not be disbursed in case of violation of the laws and decisions regulating the activity of the Authority, except after the violation has been rectified, provided that the rectification occurs before the end of the fiscal year in which it was committed. In case of payment of the divided rental value, the receipt proving such payment must be submitted before the end of the fiscal year stipulated in the decision. The holder shall not be entitled to claim disbursement of support if proof of payment is not submitted within the specified period (before the end of the fiscal year).

### Article Five
The Authority's statistics issued from agricultural areas shall be relied upon entirely for estimating the quantity of supported produce for agricultural holdings.

### Article Six
The support categories mentioned in Article One of this decision may be amended during any period, in light of the available amounts in the Authority's approved budget for the fiscal year (2026/2025).

### Article Seven
Support shall not be disbursed except after settling any dues to the Authority, whether they are amounts, fees, fines, judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as any government dues by virtue of an enforceable judicial ruling against the concerned party.

### Article Eight
All competent authorities shall implement this decision, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Resolution No. (1393) of 2026
## Regarding Support for Fruit-Bearing Palm Trees for the Fiscal Year
## (2026 / 2025)

Chairman of the Board of Directors
Director General of the Public Authority for Agricultural Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>
- Having reviewed Law No. (94) of 1983 establishing the Public Authority for Agricultural Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> – and its amendments.
- And the Authority's budget for the fiscal year 2026 / 2025.
- And Administrative Resolution No. (31) of 2025 regarding the assignment of Mr. Salem Hay Salem Hay <orig>سالم حاي سالم حاي</orig>, in addition to his current duties, to perform the functions of the Director General of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> in certain competencies.
- And based on what was presented by the Deputy Director General for Plant Resources Affairs.
- And Board of Directors Resolution No. (M.H.Z. / 90 / 2025) (Minutes No. (3) of 2025) approving the draft resolution for supporting fruit-bearing palm trees for the fiscal year 2026 / 2025.
- And for the requirements of the public interest.

Has resolved:
### Article One
Support for fruit-bearing palm trees of the following varieties (Barhi <orig>برحي</orig> – Ikhlas <orig>إخلاص</orig> – Sukkari <orig>سكري</orig> – Medjool <orig>مجدول</orig> – Umm Al-Dahan <orig>أم الدهن</orig> – Nabut Saif <orig>نبوت سيف</orig>) shall be disbursed for the fiscal year 2026/2025 at a rate of (1.5) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for each fruit-bearing palm tree, according to the following rules:
1.  Palm tree support shall be disbursed at a rate of one fruit-bearing palm tree for every 64 m² of the total utilized area.
2.  In the event of relinquishing the right of usufruct of the holding, support shall be disbursed in light of the declaration signed by the assignor and the assignee.
3.  Support for fruit-bearing palm trees shall be disbursed after inspection and verification of the palm trees' traces, in accordance with the Authority's statistics for eligible palm trees, which are recorded in the census form by the competent Agricultural Department.
4.  A condition for eligible palm trees is that they must be free from all diseases, especially the Red Palm Weevil <orig>سوسة النخيل الحمراء</orig>, and the inventory form shall not be registered until the treatment of the palm trees is confirmed.
5.  Support for fruit-bearing palm trees shall be disbursed for the agricultural areas (Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> – Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig>) as well as for holdings allocated for plant production in Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig>.
6.  No support shall be disbursed for holdings where the value of support for fruit-bearing palm trees is less than 50 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
7.  Support for fruit-bearing palm trees shall not be disbursed for holdings with more than one partner unless a delegation form is signed for one of the partners.

### Article Two
Support shall not be disbursed until the outstanding rental value for the plot is paid and a receipt proving this is submitted, provided that this occurs before the end of the fiscal year stipulated in the resolution.

### Article Three
The disbursement of support shall be suspended in case of violation of the provisions of laws, regulations, and resolutions governing the practice of the activity, and it shall not be disbursed until the violation is rectified, provided that the rectification occurs before the end of the fiscal year stipulated in the resolution.

### Article Four
Support shall not be disbursed until any dues to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> are paid, whether they are amounts, fees, fines, judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as any government dues by virtue of an enforceable judicial ruling against the concerned party.

### Article Five
The support categories mentioned in Article One of this resolution may be amended at any time, in light of the amounts available in the Authority's approved budget for the fiscal year 2026/2025.

### Article Six
Support for fruit-bearing palm trees shall be provided within the limits of the amount allocated in the Authority's budget for the fiscal year 2026/2025.

### Article Seven
All competent authorities shall implement this resolution – and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Issued on: September 8, 2025 AD
The Director General

### Article Two
- Subsidized feed shall be disbursed according to the following controls:
> First: Livestock Breeders (Sheep - Camels - Hobby Cattle - Purebred Arabian Horses):
1.  Subsidized feed shall be disbursed to breeders by virtue of a disbursable feed card, approved based on a valid vaccination certificate and according to the feed allocations due to each of them, issued by the Authority.
2.  Subsidized feed shall be disbursed with the original civil ID of the beneficiary or their legal representative with a special power of attorney, provided that the power of attorney is authenticated with the original ID of the principal.
3.  For heirs, an official power of attorney from the heirs to one of them or their representative shall be submitted to receive the subsidized feed on their behalf.
4.  For return invoices, they must be accompanied by the original civil ID of the concerned person through whom the feed was disbursed.
5.  It is permissible to replace barley with a feed material from ready-mixed feed types only.
> Second: Poultry and Ostrich Companies and Farms:
- The mechanism by which subsidized feed is disbursed:
1.  Submission of the purchase invoice, if the purchase is local, or the veterinary health release statement in case of import from abroad, to the Poultry Diseases Department <orig>قسم أمراض الدواجن</orig> of the Animal Health Department <orig>إدارة الصحة الحيوانية</orig>, along with a statement clarifying the type, number, and housing location.
2.  If the Poultry Diseases Department <orig>قسم أمراض الدواجن</orig> approves from a health perspective, it shall stamp the invoice or the veterinary health release statement and send it to the Poultry Department <orig>قسم الدواجن</orig> of the Animal Production Department <orig>إدارة الإنتاج الحيواني</orig>.
3.  The Poultry Department <orig>قسم الدواجن</orig> shall conduct a field visit to the farm (housing location) to inspect the consignment (chicks) and match it with the purchase invoice, then submit a report to the Animal Support Department <orig>قسم الدعم الحيواني</orig> and the Poultry Diseases Department <orig>قسم أمراض الدواجن</orig> clarifying the number, age, and type for approval and entry into the computerized record.
    a- If the broiler chicken consignment arrives before the 15th of the month, the due feed quantity shall be disbursed in the same month.
    b- If the broiler chicken consignment arrives after the 15th of the month, the due feed quantity shall be disbursed in the following month.
    c- If the laying hen consignment arrives during any month, the feed quantity shall be disbursed from the date of arrival of the consignment, starting from the third month.
4.  The company or farm must submit the purchase invoice or the veterinary health release statement within one week from the date of arrival of the consignment (chicks), and invoices submitted after this week from the date of arrival of the consignment will not be considered.
5.  The Animal Support Department <orig>قسم الدعم الحيواني</orig> shall send a list to the Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig> every (month) containing the names of the poultry companies and farms eligible for feed subsidies, specifying the feed allocations.
6.  If any company or farm submits invoices with the aim of obtaining subsidized feed and it is proven that the consignment (chicks) does not match the poultry invoice or the Poultry Diseases Department <orig>قسم أمراض الدواجن</orig>, the following actions will be taken:
    a- Suspension of subsidy for this company or farm for (6 months) for the first instance.
    b- If this occurs again, the subsidy will be suspended for a full year from the date of its occurrence.
    c- In case of continued violation, the Authority has the right to take the necessary action against the violating company or farm.
7.  Subsidized feed shall be disbursed for laying hens, broiler chickens, and parent stock as follows:

# Secondly: Broiler Chickens:
Feed allocations for broiler chickens shall be disbursed in a single installment during the rearing period, which lasts (40) days.
Feed material may not be substituted with another unless the required feed material is depleted, in which case it shall be replaced only with a feed material from the types of ready-mixed feeds.

# Thirdly: Companies and Farms Producing Fresh Milk:
1- The Animal Production Center <orig>مركز الإنتاج الحيواني</orig> in Sulaibiya <orig>الصلبية</orig>, affiliated with the Animal Resources Department <orig>قسم الثروة الحيوانية</orig>, shall conduct field visits to farms to submit a report documenting the number of herd mortalities (milking cows – dry pregnant cows – bulls – growing animals – suckling calves) for each farm.
2- The Animal Support Department <orig>قسم الدعم الحيواني</orig> shall calculate the quantities allocated to each farm according to the schedule of designated feed rations.
3- The Animal Support Department <orig>قسم الدعم الحيواني</orig> shall send a statement to Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig> every (3) months, specifying the quantities and types of feed due for disbursement to each company or farm.
4- The type of feed may be substituted according to the desire of companies and farms raising milk-producing cows, provided that the allocated quantity of feed and the amounts designated for it are not exceeded. This is subject to the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> approval, provided that the substitution occurs once every three months, at most 15 days before the calculation of quarterly feed rations and before sending the statements to Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig>.
5- Subsidized feed shall be disbursed to farms and companies that import cows for production purposes immediately upon the arrival of the consignment (imported cows) at the veterinary quarantine and their vaccination. They shall be treated like "air cows" <orig>أبقار الهواء</orig> in terms of feed allocations. After the prescribed quarantine period ends and they are transferred to the company or farm, they shall be treated like cows already present on the farm.
6- Companies and farms that raise cows and calves but do not supply fresh milk to companies and dairy factories approved by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall be treated as "air cows" <orig>أبقار الهواء</orig> when subsidized feed is disbursed to them.
7- Violating farms shall have all their transactions and services suspended, except for the disbursement of subsidized feed for the benefit of the animal, where the cattle herd shall be treated as "air cows" <orig>أبقار الهواء</orig> for the disbursement of subsidized feed.
8- Subsidized feed shall be disbursed to owners of agricultural holdings designated for cattle rearing and agricultural holdings that possess an auxiliary animal production license (cattle rearing), provided they meet the technical and health conditions and are not in violation, according to the approved feed allocation statement.

## Article Three
*   General Rules:
    1- Subsidized feed allocations for cattle and poultry companies and farms may be fragmented according to their needs during the month, and they shall not be entitled to claim them later if not withdrawn within the same month.
    2- Subsidized feed allocations for livestock breeders (sheep – camels – cattle) may not be fragmented, and the entire quantity must be withdrawn in one go within the same month.
    3- Approved statements from the competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> shall be sent to the Flour Mills Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق</orig>, specifying the quantities and types of feed due for disbursement to cattle, poultry, and ostrich companies and farms.
    4- Electronic chips shall not be transferred in the name of the breeder (buyer) during the month in which the support is due for disbursement in the name of the breeder (seller). They may be transferred during the following month, and the vaccination certificate and feed card shall be issued to the breeder in the name of the breeder (buyer).
    5- The quantity previously allocated on the feed card issued in the name of the breeder (seller) shall be adjusted starting from the chip transfer, and the support shall be disbursed according to the number of animals allocated to them.
    6- The competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> within the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> has the right to conduct periodic inspections of animal numbers at any time and as determined by the relevant department, prepare a report on any violations found, and submit it to the Council <orig>المجلس</orig> for appropriate action.

## Article Four
Subsidized animal feed shall be disbursed by virtue of an automated disbursement permit issued by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, specifying the types and quantities of feed materials due according to the feed card during the month. A statement of quantities delivered to breeders from the warehouses of Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig> shall be sent via the automated network system linking the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and the company for each financial claim submitted by them for the disbursement of the due support value, after being signed by the concerned party for claim authentication.

## Article Five
The value of the support shall be disbursed within the limits of the amount approved by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> and allocated for feed support in the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> budget for the fiscal year 2023 – 2024.

## Article Six
The concerned party must comply with all laws and regulations issued by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, as well as the health and technical conditions and decisions regulating the practice of the activity. The disbursement of support to violating breeders (sheep – camels – cattle – "air cows" <orig>هواء</orig>) shall be suspended from the date the violation is recorded against the concerned party by the competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> within the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> for the months of violation. Disbursement shall resume from the first day of the following month after the violation is rectified, as the suspension will be

### Article One
Support shall be disbursed for locally born and raised heifers to owners of holdings designated for cattle breeding in Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> area and agricultural holdings that have an auxiliary animal production license (cattle breeding), which meet the technical and health conditions and supply raw milk to licensed local Kuwaiti dairy companies, according to the regulations enforced by the Authority, in cash, with a total amount of 150 K.D. (one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) per head, provided that the disbursement is made in two installments as follows:
- The first installment of 60 Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> shall be disbursed when the heifer reaches the age of (9 months).
- The second installment of 90 Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> shall be disbursed when the heifer reaches the age of (18 months).

### Article Two
The breeder must notify the Authority in case of new births within one week of birth, so that the Authority's affiliated center can, in turn, carry out the numbering of new heifers and enter them into the support records. Also, within one week in case the Authority's number is lost from the heifer, to place an alternative number and inform the Animal Health Department <orig>إدارة الصحة الحيوانية</orig> to monitor its health and install an electronic chip. In case of failure to notify within the mentioned period, the breeder shall not be entitled to claim any support entitlements or any other compensation.

The feed card for the breeder or their representative on the automated system.

### Article Seven
The feed card shall be suspended for a period of no less than 3 months for the breeder or their representative if they assault an employee during the performance of their duties, while preserving the employee's right to recourse against the breeder.

### Article Eight
The concerned party is obligated to preserve the subsidized materials and use them in the methods specified by the Authority and Law No. 10 of 1979 regarding the supervision of trade in goods, services, and handicrafts, and the determination of prices for some of them, and its executive regulations.

### Article Nine
It is required to submit proof of payment by the concerned party of the annual rental value of the plot due to the Authority for the last year before the end of the fiscal year for holders of plots or agricultural holdings. In case of non-payment, the disbursement of subsidized feed allocations shall be suspended.

### Article Ten
Support shall not be disbursed except after deducting any amounts due to the Authority, whether they are fees, financial fines, enforceable judicial rulings, or others, as well as amounts due to any government entity by virtue of a judicial ruling against the concerned party.

### Article Eleven
In the event of price adjustment and increase according to global feed price developments by the Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig>, the breeder shall bear the increase in price differences.

### Article Twelve
Support categories shall be adjusted according to global feed price developments and shall be within the limits of the approved budget for the fiscal year 2023-2024.

### Article Thirteen
The concerned sector is obligated to determine the quantities of subsidized feed allocations in accordance with the controls enforced by the Authority and the decisions regulating them, and the relevant authorities shall be notified accordingly.

### Article Fourteen
All concerned authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

- And on Ministerial Decision <orig>القرار الوزاري</orig> No. (13) of 2024 issued on 28/03/2024 AD, regarding the assignment of Ms. Asma Murshid Mariq Al-Otaibi <orig>أسماء مرشد مارق العتيبي</orig> (Director of Legal Affairs Department <orig>مدير إدارة الشئون القانونية</orig>) in the Director General's Sector <orig>قطاع المدير العام</orig>, in addition to her current duties, to perform the duties of (Director General of the Public Authority for Agricultural Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>المدير العام للهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>).
- And on the budget of the Public Authority for Agricultural Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 AD.
- And based on the exigencies and interests of work.

## Article One
Fresh milk support shall be disbursed to holdings designated for cattle rearing in Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> area and agricultural holdings that have a license for auxiliary animal production (cattle rearing), which meet the technical and health conditions and supply raw milk to licensed local Kuwaiti dairy companies and factories, in accordance with the regulations enforced by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>.

## Article Two
Financial support amounting to (80) fils (eighty fils) shall be disbursed for each liter of fresh milk produced from holdings designated for cattle rearing and agricultural holdings that have a license for auxiliary animal production (cattle rearing), which is delivered to Kuwaiti dairy manufacturing companies and factories, provided that it conforms to the Kuwaiti standard conditions and specifications related to raw milk.

## Article Three
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall consider applications submitted by affected holding owners regarding

## Article Three
No support shall be granted for calves that die at an age of less than 4 months. In the event of calves dying at an age of (4) months or more, the government veterinarian <orig>الطبيب البيطري الحكومي</orig> shall submit a report to the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> Seventh Center <orig>المركز السابع</orig> to take the necessary action regarding the calculation of the support value allocated for the calf during its rearing, according to the following table:

## Article Four
The disbursement of support shall be within the limits of the amount allocated in the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> budget for the fiscal year 2024/2025, and the disbursement shall be in cash.

## Article Five
The concerned party <orig>صاحب العلاقة</orig> must comply with all laws and regulations issued by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, health and technical conditions, decisions regulating the practice of the activity, and procedures stipulated in Decision No. (2002/162) regarding punitive measures for violators of the calf support decision and any amendments that may occur thereto. The disbursement of support shall be suspended in case of violation, and no disbursement shall be made for suspended amounts during the violation period or claims for their entitlement. Disbursement of support shall resume for the next payment after the violation is rectified.

## Article Six
Support shall not be disbursed except after deducting any dues owed to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, whether they are fees, fines, enforceable judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as dues owed to any government entity <orig>جهة حكومية</orig> by virtue of a judicial ruling against the concerned party <orig>صاحب العلاقة</orig>.

## Article Seven
Any of the veterinary clinics <orig>المستوصفات البيطرية</orig> affiliated with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> must be informed in case of selling any cattle, for the purpose of health monitoring of the animal and tracking its location. Anyone who violates this shall be subject to Decision 2002/162 referred to, and any amendments that may occur thereto.

## Article Eight
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Resolution No. PAI (353) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industrial Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig> and its executive regulations and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (2025/5) issued on 2025/3/9, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Disturbing Areas Department <orig>قسم المناطق المقلقة</orig> No. (321), dated 2025/09/09, which includes the following violations committed by the occupant of plot (573):
    *   Encroachment outside the plot boundaries by an area of 32 meters.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
*   And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has resolved
### Article One
To close plot No. (573) located in South Amghara <orig>جنوب أمغرة</orig> area – Block (1), until the violations and their consequences are removed.
### Article Two
In the event of failure to remove the violation after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
### Article Three
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

Issued on: September 9, 2025 AD

Disbursement of support due to its inability to supply milk for reasons beyond its control, according to an approved report from the competent authority within the Public Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, and the Authority's decision in this regard shall be final.
### Article Four
Disbursement shall be within the approved and allocated amount for fresh milk support in the Authority's budget for the fiscal year (2024 / 2025).
### Article Five
It is required that the concerned party provides proof of payment of the annual rental value of the plot due to the Authority for the last year before the end of the fiscal year for holders of plots or agricultural holdings.
### Article Six
Support shall not be disbursed except after the payment of any dues to the Authority, whether fees, fines, enforceable judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as dues to any government entity by virtue of a judicial ruling against the concerned party.
### Article Seven
The concerned party must comply with all laws and regulations issued by the Authority, as well as health and technical conditions and decisions regulating the practice of the activity. Disbursement of support shall be suspended if a violation is proven, and suspended amounts may not be disbursed during the violation period or claimed as due. Disbursement of support shall resume after the removal of the violation, starting from the following month.
### Article Eight

### Regarding the Closure of a Plot
The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industrial Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

# Decision No. (179) of 2025
## Regarding the amendment of certain provisions concerning the right to object to resolutions of General Assemblies of listed joint-stock companies

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- And the decision of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> issued at its meeting No. (32) of 2025 held on 2025/10/01.

Has decided the following:

### Article One
Book Nine (Mergers and Acquisitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and their amendments, shall be amended in accordance with Annex No. (1) of this Decision.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>**
**Emad Ahmed Tifouni <orig>عماد أحمد تيفوني</orig>**

Issued on: October 2, 2025 AD

<table_caption>Annex No. 1: Amendments to Article 12 of Book 9, Chapter 3 of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the right to object to General Assembly decisions</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Book | Chapter | Article | Type of Amendment | Text Before Amendment | Text After Amendment |
|:--|:------|:------|:------|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | Nine | Three | 12 | Amendment | Any shareholder or number of shareholders whose ownership is not less than 5% and not more than 30% of the shares of a listed company may submit an objection to the Authority, individually or collectively, against the resolutions of the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly, subject to the following conditions: 1. The objection must be submitted within fifteen days from the date of issuance of the objected-to resolution(s), whichever is later. 2. The objecting shareholders must not have approved the objected-to resolution. 3. The objected-to resolution must involve prejudice to the rights of the minority. | Any shareholder or number of shareholders whose ownership is not less than 5% and not more than 30% of the shares of a listed company may submit an objection to the Authority, individually or collectively, against the resolutions of the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly, subject to the following conditions: 1. The objection must be submitted within fifteen days from the date of issuance of the objected-to resolution(s), whichever is later. 2. The objecting shareholders must not have approved the objected-to resolution. 3. The objected-to resolution must involve prejudice to the rights of the minority and relate to the operations regulated in this Book. |
</table>

# Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
