Regarding the amendment of Annex No. (4) to Book Two (Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 and their amendments, by adding fees for the activity of a qualified securities broker registered in the stock exchange.

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- And Decision No. (101) of 2025 regarding the entry into force of the second part of the third phase of the Capital Market System Development Program;
- And based on the decision of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> No. (31) of 2025 held on 2025/09/28;

Has decided the following:

### Article One
Article 1-9 of Annex No. (4) "Schedule of Authority Services Fees" of Book Two (Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments, shall be amended in accordance with Annex (1) of this Decision.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Rayan Mohammed Al-Zaid <orig>ريان محمد الزيد</orig>**

Decided the following:

### Article One
Extension of licenses to practice insurance activities for insurance companies and insurance professions subject to the supervision of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, and extension of the registration of auditors registered with the Unit whose licenses or registrations will expire in September, October, and November of this year for a period of 90 days, effective from the date of expiry of the license or registration.

### Article Two
Companies are obligated to submit license renewal applications to the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> in accordance with Resolution No. (17) of 2025 regarding the amendment of Resolution No. (14) of 2022 concerning applications for issuing licenses to practice insurance activities and insurance professions. Auditors are also obligated to submit registration renewal applications to the Unit in accordance with Resolution No. (20) of 2022 concerning the application for registering an auditor's entry, taking into account that the aforementioned applications must be submitted at least 45 days prior to the expiry date of the extension stipulated in Article One of this Resolution.

### Article Three
The Unit shall review the registration / license renewal application within 30 days from the date the application fulfills all required documents. Companies or auditors are prohibited from practicing the activity after the expiry of the license or registration period and before the Unit's decision approving the application is issued.

### Article Four
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>

 |
<table>
| Article No. (6) of Resolution No. (19) of 2025 regarding the rules for issuing mandatory insurance policies | Amendment to the Text | A mandatory insurance policy may not be cancelled except after obtaining prior official approval from the competent authority or from the date of the judgment declaring the insured company bankrupt. In all cases, the licensed companies and the insured / subscriber remain bound by the provisions of this policy with regard to the obligations arising therefrom before its cancellation. The insured company is obligated to refund the premium / subscription amount to the insured / subscriber if the process of issuing the mandatory policy or commencing insurance coverage is not completed for any reason, and the insured company's receipt of the said amount in this case shall be considered as a trust. |
| Article No. (7) of Resolution No. (19) of 2025 regarding the rules for issuing mandatory insurance policies | Amendment to the Text | All mandatory insurance policies are subject to cancellation provisions in accordance with the laws, regulations, and decisions issued by the competent authorities regulating such policies. Furthermore, the insured company, when issuing policies, must state the company's policy and procedures for policy cancellation and include them in the general terms and conditions of mandatory insurance policies, along with clarifying the rights and responsibilities arising from the cancellation process for the insured / subscriber. The insurer, upon cancelling the policy, must adhere to the following: 1. State the formula and method for calculating the amount due / refundable from the insurance premium / subscription to the insured upon policy cancellation. 2. Refund the remaining premium / subscription amount for the remaining days to the insured / subscriber without deducting fees, expenses, or compensations if the cancellation was not initiated by the insurer, provided that the cancellation is justified. 3. Commit to notifying the insured / subscriber upon policy cancellation in a manner that does not conflict with regulating laws, even if issued through an insurance broker / agent in accordance with the law. 4. The insurer's commitment to dispatch the insured / subscriber during the notification period when cancelling the insurance policy. 5. No cancellation by either party shall be considered valid unless notification is made through a written letter delivered to the other party or through one of the approved electronic means, accompanied by the mechanism of the procedures mentioned above. 6. The insurer shall, within a period not exceeding (5) working days from the date of the competent authority's approval of the policy cancellation, refund any remaining part of the insurance premium / subscription – if any – to the insured / subscriber. The insured / subscriber is not entitled to any refunded amount if there is any claim related to the policy, whether paid or under settlement, or if the delay was due to negligence or default, unless the excuse is acceptable. In all cases, the insured company is obligated to notify the insured / subscriber of the outcome of the procedures mentioned above. |
</table>

In the event that the claimant acknowledges the existence of coverage from another insurance company, the company has the right to request a certificate from the other insurance company stating that no compensation has been paid by it for the same claim, all without obligating any party to fees or amounts for this certificate.

### Article No. (14) of Resolution No. (19) of 2025 regarding the Rules for Issuing Compulsory Insurance Policies
Amendment to the Text

Insuring companies are obligated, when issuing compulsory insurance policies, not to grant commissions exceeding 15% of the value of the insurance premium/subscription.

### Article No. (16) of Resolution No. (19) of 2025 regarding the Rules for Issuing Compulsory Insurance Policies
Amendment to the Text

1- The premium/subscription amount is divided on the following basis:

<table_caption>Premium/Subscription Division</table_caption>
<table>
| Premium (Policy) |
|:---|
| According to Law No. (125) of 2019 |
| And its Executive Regulations and Regulating Resolutions |
| Total |
</table>

2- Regarding the work injury and occupational disease insurance policy, the company is obligated to calculate the workers' insurance policy premium/subscription according to the following equation:
Total Liability Limits = Total Monthly Wages * 12 Months
Total Insurance Premium/Subscription = Total Liability Limits * Pricing (RATE) * Supervision and Control Fees

### Article No. (18) of Resolution No. (19) of 2025 regarding the Rules for Issuing Compulsory Insurance Policies
Amendment to the Text

The insuring company is obligated, upon receiving any claim related to compulsory insurance policies, to do the following:
1. Notify the applicant by any approved written or electronic means immediately upon opening the claim file, specifying all received documents and unreceived data that must be completed to estimate the due compensation for the completion of the claim settlement.
2. Notify the claimant by any approved written or electronic means within a period not exceeding (5) working days from the completion of documents, of the acceptance or rejection of the claim.
3. Settle and pay claim amounts fairly and without any bargaining with the affected party within a maximum period of (10) working days from the date of claim acceptance.
4. In case of claim rejection, the insuring company is obligated to provide the claimant with the reasons for rejection in writing or electronically, accompanied by documents and supporting evidence for the rejection decision.
5. The insuring company must commit to settling claim amounts within a period not exceeding thirty days from the date of completion of all documents. In the event of the company's delay in settling the claim within the mentioned period, it must submit to the Unit the reasons for the delay. If the reasons are not acceptable to the Unit, the company's liability shall be established according to Article Nineteen of this Resolution.

# Administrative Decision No. (29) of 2025
## Regarding the Suspension of Insurance Activities of Oriental Insurance Limited <orig>شركة أورينتال انشورنس ليمتد</orig>

Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>, its Executive Regulations and their amendments, and the regulatory decisions and circulars.
- And the official notification served to the company on 21/8/2025,
- And the meeting of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> in its meeting No. (8) of 2025 on 23/9/2025,
- And based on the requirements of public interest,
Has decided the following:
### Article One
Suspension of Oriental Insurance Limited <orig>شركة أورينتال انشورنس ليمتد</orig> from practicing all insurance activities for a period of (90) days, commencing from the date of issuance of this decision and ending on 31/12/2025.
This is due to the following reasons:
- Continued decline in the company's solvency margin from 2023 to date without remedy.
- The company's refusal to provide the Unit with a recent statement of judgment enforcement issued by the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> - Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> - regarding the company as a defendant.
- Continued existence of a serious financial deficit with the company to date and its refusal to provide the actuary with the required data.
- Continued existence of accumulated losses with the company until the end of the financial year ending on December 31, 2024, and the company's non-compliance with the plan submitted by it on 5/7/2023 to extinguish these losses.
### Article Two
The company must rectify the violations attributed to it under the preceding Article during the suspension period. It is prohibited from issuing new insurance policies or renewing or extending existing policies during the suspension period.
### Article Three
The suspension shall be lifted from the company by a decision issued by the Unit if it removes the causes of the violations attributed to it during the suspension period stipulated in Article One of this decision.
### Article Four
All insurance policies and their endorsements issued prior to the date of this decision shall remain valid, including the rights, obligations, and guarantees contained therein, and the company is committed to continuing to carry out the administrative work associated with them.
### Article Five
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decision No. (30) of 2025
## Regarding the Update of the Approved List of Companies Qualified to Issue the Civil Liability Insurance Policy Arising from Traffic Accidents (Compulsory Motor Insurance)

Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>, its Executive Regulations and their amendments, and the regulatory decisions and circulars.
- And Decision No. (70) of 2023 regarding the issuance of the system for unifying the civil liability insurance policy arising from traffic accidents (Compulsory Motor Insurance).
- And Decision No. (3) of 2024 regarding the regulation of controls and conditions for contracting with repair workshops approved by licensed insurance companies.
- And Decision No. (14) of 2024 regarding the amendment of Decision No. (70) of 2023 regarding the issuance of the system for unifying the civil liability insurance policy arising from traffic accidents.
- And Decision No. (25) of 2024 regarding the determination of the period of operation for Decision No. (7) of 2024.
- And Decision No. (29) of 2025 regarding the suspension of insurance activities of Oriental Insurance Limited <orig>شركة أورينتال انشورنس ليمتد</orig>.
- And the decision of the Supreme Committee in its meeting No. (8) of 2025 on 23/09/2025.
- And based on the requirements of public interest,
Has decided the following:
### Article One
Oriental Insurance Limited <orig>شركة أورينتال انشورنس ليمتد</orig> shall be excluded from the approved list of companies qualified to issue the civil liability insurance policy arising from traffic accidents (Compulsory Motor Insurance), and the list shall be updated according to Annex No. (1) of this decision.
### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>
Issued on: 2 October 2025 AD
Issued on: 2 October 2025 AD

## Decision No. 1 / 201 - R / 2025
Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. S / MS / 51/2025/2026 for the development and support of the overseas treatment management program among companies and institutions specialized in this field and registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>, in accordance with the general and special conditions outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw) for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
A letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be attached when submitting the booklet, confirming compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104/Fifth of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 20/10/2025, at the tenders box in the General Diwan of the Ministry of Health <orig>ديوان عام وزارة الصحة</orig> (Al-Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building – First Floor – Procurement Department – Practices Section). Bids shall be valid for (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) two percent only of the bid value, valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Note: Priority will be given to owners of small and medium enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

# Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>
## Announcement
The Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> announces the offering of General Practice No. (5 / 2025 - 2026) regarding the development and modernization of Uninterruptible Power Supplies (UPS) at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>. Therefore, specialized companies / establishments in this field are requested to review the Equipment and Contracts Department (Contracts and Tenders Section) at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> (Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - Third Floor - ZONE 5) to obtain the documents for this practice for a fee of (50 K.D.) only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, payable via (K-Net). Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises are exempted from these fees, provided they furnish proof thereof, and must bring a copy of the practice announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:-

1.  Registration receipt with the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> for the fiscal year 2025 - 2026 or
2.  A copy of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> license.
3.  A copy of the Commercial Register.
4.  A copy of the civil ID number for the establishment or company.
5.  A copy of the company's articles of association (if any).
6.  A copy of the valid registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
7.  A copy of the valid registration receipt with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
8.  A copy of the practitioner's signature authorization.
9.  A valid certificate from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the percentage of national labor.
10. An authorization letter from the company / establishment for the person authorized to purchase the practice documents.

Please note that the preliminary meeting for receiving any inquiries is on Tuesday, 14/10/2025, at 11:00 AM, and the closing date (last date for submitting bids) is on Tuesday, 21/10/2025, from 9:00 AM until 1:00 PM. The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary security deposit in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the banks accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>, amounting to (420 K.D.) only four hundred and twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. The preliminary security deposit and the bid must remain valid for (60) days from the date of bid opening. Any bids not accompanied by the full security deposit or submitted after the aforementioned deadline will not be accepted. For any inquiries or coordination

## Announcement 105 / 2025

The holder of the following license has submitted an application to the Municipality:

<table_caption>Contractor Information for Announcement 105/2025</table_caption>
<table>
| Commercial Name | Tam International Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة تام الدولية للتجارة والمقاولات</orig> |
|:---|:---|
| Category | Municipality Contractor, Category D |
| Registration Number | 7200511 |
</table>

Requests the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality, in view of its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit an application to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation shall issue its decision thereon after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- The lapse of fifteen (15) days from the date of publication of this application in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the refund of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Section <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside of the envelope, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 2025/11/2.

*   The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Monday, 2025/10/13, at 12:00 PM (noon) in the meeting hall of the Engineering Affairs Sector <orig>قطاع الشئون الهندسية</orig> – Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> – Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything discussed in the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the practice documents and shall be binding on all bidders. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all bidders before the bid closing date.
*   All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, in 3 copies, with the exception of (the bid form, initial security deposit, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder's data form).
*   The practice is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend the bid opening session, after coordinating with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the scheduled date for the bid opening session.
*   A valid national labor compliance certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempt from the prescribed fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article 39 of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to participate in the practice must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.

**Requests the Companies Department of this Ministry:**
To convert the individual license issued under number: 3529/2005 - dated 24/5/2022
Under the trade name: Gulf Aluminum Exhibition <orig>معرض الومنيوم الخليج</orig>
And convert it into a One-Person Company
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit a written objection, accompanied by a debt instrument, to the aforementioned department within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, otherwise it will not be taken into consideration.

## Announcement
**Submitted by the owners of Al-Nahda Al-Arabiya Commercial Company <orig>النهضة العربية التجارية</orig> ## Company Under Liquidation**
Requests the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry to carry out: Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
Legal Entity: Limited Liability Company
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership, only in the face of this creditor, until a judicial ruling is issued on their objection.

### Announcement
The owners of Wudroob General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>ودروب للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> have submitted a request. ## The company is under liquidation.
A request has been submitted to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry for the dissolution and liquidation of the company.
Legal Entity: Limited Liability Company
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until a judicial ruling is issued on their objection.

### Moya Real Estate Project Management Company (K.S.C.C.) Closed <orig>شركة مويا لإدارة المشاريع العقارية (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**

At 11:30 AM on Wednesday, 27/08/2025, the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the company was held in Al-Mirqab, Al-Tujjar Tower <orig>برج التجار</orig> – 5th Floor, Office 36.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Abdulwahab Mishari Al-Ghazali <orig>عبد الوهاب مشاري الغزالي</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors.
The attendance rate, in person and by proxy, reached 89.942% of the shares, totaling 2,968,060 shares.
The Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Abdulwahab Mishari Al-Ghazali <orig>عبد الوهاب مشاري الغزالي</orig>, opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then proceeded to the agenda of the company's Extraordinary General Assembly, and the following was accomplished:

**Item One:** Approval was granted to add the activities of (Real Estate Management and Leasing) and (Buying and Selling Shares for the Company's Account) by amending Article No. (5) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article No. (4) of the Articles of Association as follows:
Text before amendment: The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Management of third-party properties, Activity Code 682021
2- Building maintenance service, Activity Code 811003
3- Utilizing financial surpluses in financial portfolios by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities, Activity Code 649918
Text after amendment: The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Management of third-party properties, Activity Code 682021
2- Building maintenance service, Activity Code 811003
3- Utilizing financial surpluses in financial portfolios by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities, Activity Code 649918
4- Management and leasing of owned or leased real estate, Activity Code 681020
5- Buying and selling shares and bonds for the company's account, Activity Code 649917

**Item Two:** Approval was granted to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 330,000 to KWD 660,000 by distributing bonus shares amounting to KWD 330,000, representing 100% of the retained earnings, to shareholders registered in the company's register as of the date of the General Assembly meeting, and authorizing the Board of Directors to dispose of fractional shares, if any.

**Item Three:** Approval was granted to amend Article No. (6) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association as follows:
Article before amendment: The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital was set at KWD 330,000 (only three hundred and thirty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only), distributed over 3,300,000 shares (only three million three hundred thousand shares only, the value of each

After the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was announced, a number of shareholders representing the minority, according to attendance proxies, owning 112,000 shares, representing 0.04% of the paid-up capital, authorized Mr. Mahmoud Mahdi Awad Abu Bakr <orig>محمود مهدي عوض أبوبكر</orig> to vote on their behalf on the agenda items. Mr. Haider Mohammed Al-Zankawi <orig>حيدر محمد الزنكوي</orig> opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly for discussion. The following was resolved:
Amendment of Article No. (14) of the Articles of Association to determine the number of Board of Directors members as follows:
Article before amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (8) members (eight members) elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. Each shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own therein, all in accordance with the regulations stipulated in the Companies Law.
Article after amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (4) members (four members) elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. Each shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own therein, all in accordance with the regulations stipulated in the Companies Law.
This item was approved unanimously by the attending shareholders.
At the conclusion of the meeting, Mr. Haider Mohammed Al-Zankawi <orig>حيدر محمد الزنكوي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at exactly 11:15 AM on the same day.

and Chairman of the General Assembly Council

# Announcement
Regarding a Lost Certificate

Based on Ministerial Resolution No. (2000/89) issued on 13/6/2000 AD, regarding the issuance of a replacement certificate (for a lost one).
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces that / Mohammed Ibrahim Zazzam <orig>محمد ابراهيم زظام</orig>, Al-Ikhlas <orig>الاخلاص</orig> Private Co-ed Secondary School for Boys, has lost his original certificate, and a replacement certificate is being issued for him after publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>).

## Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. P/MS/2025/2026/50 for the replacement of a main water chiller operating with a water cooling system and its accessories at the main cooling station at Al-Farwaniya Hospital <orig>مستشفى الفروانية</orig> among companies and institutions specialized in this field, according to the general and special conditions outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw) for a payment of (75 K.D.) only.
It is necessary to attach a letter of authorization from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104/Fifth of 2008 concerning the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 27/10/2025, at the tenders box in the General Diwan of the Ministry of Health <orig>ديوان عام وزارة الصحة</orig> (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building <orig>مبنى وزارة الصحة</orig> – First Floor – Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Practices Section <orig>قسم الممارسات</orig>). Tenders are valid for 100% of the tender value for the entire duration of the tender's validity.
Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

## First: The Building Where the Disputed Property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is Located:

- The plaintiff <orig>المدعي</orig> guided the expert <orig>الخبير</orig> regarding the components of the building where the disputed property <orig>العين محل النزاع</orig> is located.
- The building is located within a residential complex, which is the Al-Sarraf Pearl Complex <orig>مجمع لؤلؤة الصراف</orig>, consisting of (6) identical buildings with a shared basement for car parking. An additional building has been added to the residential complex, but it does not have an entrance leading to the complex's basement.
- The residential complex is located on two internal streets (front and back) and is bordered on both sides by neighboring buildings.
- One of the internal streets is opposite Al-Qutoof School <orig>المدرسة القطوف</orig>, while the other street is opposite a mosque and a branch of Al-Rawda and Hawally Cooperative Society <orig>الروضة وحولي التعاونية</orig>.
- The building is in a moderate structural condition, with central air conditioning and Sigma cladding.
- Each building has an elevator and a shared staircase between every two buildings, extending from the basement to the roof, except for the added building, which does not share a staircase with any of the other buildings.
- There is also an emergency staircase in each apartment leading to the ground floor.
- The building consists of: a ground floor (suspended) shared by all other buildings (except the added building), and (8) identical floors, with only one apartment on each floor.
- All apartments in the building are identical in components and include: a master bedroom – two bedrooms with a shared bathroom – a living room – a kitchen – a maid's room with an attached bathroom inside it – a driver's room with an attached bathroom located outside the apartment.
- The plaintiff <orig>المدعي</orig> stated that the added building has a swimming pool on the ground floor used by all residents of the residential complex, but it is currently closed.
- The expert <orig>الخبير</orig> found that the area indicated by the plaintiff <orig>المدعي</orig> for the swimming pool had been fenced.
- There is a restaurant in the residential complex with the trade name "Bin Aneij" <orig>بن عنيج</orig>.
- One parking space in the basement of the residential complex has been allocated for the disputed property <orig>العين محل النزاع</orig>.

## Second: Auction Terms:

### First:

The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

### Second:

The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.

### Third:

If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.

### Fourth:

If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.

### Fifth:

If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value, and the defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

### Sixth:

In all cases, the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

The property consists of a basement, ground floor, service floors, floors 1 to 10 repeated, service floor 11, floors 12 to 21 repeated + 22, and a roof. It does not conform to the attached license No. 215/2009. The service floors have been converted into offices, and there are architectural modifications (internal partitions) on all floors. This violates building regulations and systems, except for the basement, mezzanine, and floors 2-6-7, for which amendment licenses have been added (2020/274, 2020/485, 2023/608, 2023/618).
*Inspection:
On 19/1/2025, we proceeded to the property subject of the lawsuit, located in Sharq <orig>شرق</orig> area, Plot 1, Ahmed Al-Jaber <orig>أحمد الجابر</orig> Street, Parcel 3B, with automated number 93306411. The inspection was conducted in the presence of Mr. Ibrahim Al-Khaji <orig>إبراهيم الخجي</orig>, Administrative Expertise Expert, as follows:
The disputed property is a commercial building located on one street and a back alley, consisting of a basement, ground floor, mezzanine, service floor, and 23 repeated floors. It is bordered on both sides by two buildings, and at the back by an alley and parking spaces. Its exterior cladding is Alucobond, and it bears the name Al-Sarraf Commercial Tower <orig>برج الصراف التجاري</orig>. Its area is 548.5 m2 as stated in the document.
The basement floor is designated for company offices, and the ground floor, from the front facade, is designated for a restaurant and cafe. The entrance to the upper floors is located in the back alley, and the staircase has 4 elevators leading to the rest of the floors. The mezzanine is designated for company offices, in addition to 23 floors, and floor 'S' is designated as a service floor, in addition to central air conditioning in the property.
The agent of the first defendant company stated that the property is fully leased and that the total income from the property is estimated at approximately 49,500 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> per month.
Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price of (9,000,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>) nine million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer is approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those undertaking the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Department of Clerks <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start at a base price of 619,650 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (Six Hundred Nineteen Thousand Six Hundred Fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, upon the conclusion of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, attorney's fees, brokerage fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published according to the law, at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance (of its condition).
Notice:
1- This announcement of sale shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> according to Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, according to Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership was divested resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.

Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase in the bid, accompanied by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.

Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the preceding session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transferring and registering ownership, execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.

Notice:
1.  This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2.  The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3.  The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership was divested was residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Property Description (According to the Attached Description Certificate)

An undivided share <orig>حصه مشاعاً</orig> of (28.571428%) of the land and an undivided share <orig>حصة مشاعاً</orig> in the buildings of 12.5%, which represents the share of the first and second defendants inherited by them in the property of document No. 1986/3282, located in Al-Daiya <orig>الدعية</orig> area – Plot No. 4 – Block No. 3 – from the overall plan No. 30/295, with a total area of 2,987 square meters, by public auction with a base price of (395,840 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>) three hundred ninety-five thousand eight hundred forty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for the share offered for public auction.

** According to the description certificate:
Private residence consisting of a basement, ground floor, first floor, and roof, conforming to plans license No. 758/86.

** According to the description certificate:
The disputed property <orig>عقار النزاع</orig> located in Al-Daiya <orig>الدعية</orig> area – Block 3 – Street 41 – House 5 – Plot 4, with an area of 987.5 square meters, and the automated property number is 10449872.
The inspection was carried out as follows:
The disputed property <orig>عقار النزاع</orig> is located at the corner of Street No. 41, bordered by two neighbors on the right and left, and in front of the house there is a mosque and parking spaces.
The disputed property <orig>عقار النزاع</orig> has 3 external entrances, two main ones and one from the car garage.
The disputed property <orig>عقار النزاع</orig> consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, roof, and an annex.
The basement consists of one open hall.
The ground floor has 3 entrances, and consists of a hall, 4 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and a preparatory kitchen.
The first floor consists of a hall, 4 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and a preparatory kitchen.
The roof has a laundry room and a bathroom for servants.
The annex consists of 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a main kitchen.
The exterior cladding is stone, and the air conditioning units are separate.
Mr. Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the property and took notes.

## Second: Auction Conditions:

First: The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that
price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a
letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full
approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit one-fifth of the price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price,
otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which
the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward
in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction,
in which case the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.

2) Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (Activity Code 642020).
3) Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law (Activity Code 642030).
4) Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent (Activity Code 642040).
5) Business management office for holding activities (Activity Code 642070).
6) Owning shares solely for the account of the holding company (Activity Code 642051).
7) Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others (Activity Code 642050).
The company may carry out all or some of these purposes in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with bodies and companies that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such bodies or companies. All company purposes shall be practiced in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.

## Article (5)
The company's fiscal year begins on the first of (January) and ends on the last of (December) of each year. The first fiscal year is an exception, starting from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ending on December 31st of the following fiscal year.

## Article (6)
The company's authorized capital is set at KWD 3,700,000 (three million seven hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed over (37,000,000 shares), with a value of (100 fils) per share. All shares are cash shares. The issued capital is KWD 3,700,000 (three million seven hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and the company's capital consists of cash shares.
The founders signing the contract subscribed to the entire capital of the company as follows:
Expenses, wages, disbursements, and costs that the company committed to pay due to its establishment shall be deducted from the general expenses account.
The founders signing this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures to complete the establishment of the company and commit to excluding and canceling fictitious and duplicate subscription applications and taking the necessary measures to achieve this.
For this purpose, they have appointed Mr. Saleh Mohammed Khalid Al-Roumi <orig>صالح محمد خالد الرومي</orig> to take the legal procedures, complete the necessary documents, and introduce any amendments that the official authorities deem necessary to be included in the contract or in the attached Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the constituent assembly meeting, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed by each founder, their payment of due installments, their names, addresses, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.
The founder and the company shall be jointly and severally liable for compensating any damage incurred by the company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the company's contract.

## Article (1)
Numu Company <orig>شركة نمو</orig> for the Manufacture of Cereal Breakfast Foods in Flake Form.

## Article (2)
The company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is the domicile recognized for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is recorded in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may establish branches, agencies, or offices for it in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad.

If it is decided to increase the company's capital and some shareholders do not exercise their pre-emptive right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those shareholders of the company who wish to subscribe. If subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amount.
In all cases where the full amount of new shares is not subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be considered null and void by operation of law.

Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription, as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (11)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with 37,000,000 (thirty-seven million shares) with a nominal value of K.D. 3,700,000 (three million seven hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed among them, each according to the proportion specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>.

Article (12)
Ownership of a share inevitably entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

Article (13)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the requirements of regulatory bodies <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, and any privileges and rights that this system may stipulate for certain types of shares, each share entitles its owner to an equal share to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in distributed profits.

Article (14)
The company shall maintain a special register <orig>سجل خاص</orig> with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares they own, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded therein shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register <orig>سجل المساهمين</orig> in accordance with the data received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

Article (15)
Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>:
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

Article (16)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must call for the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of subscription. If this period expires without the assembly being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the expiry date, call for the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

Article (17)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2- Advertisement, which must be published twice, with the second advertisement published at least seven days after the date of the first advertisement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3- Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4- Any other modern means of communication specified in the executive regulations of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representatives to attend.
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

Article (18)
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares.
If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of not less than seven days and not more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be made available at a place designated by the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

Article (20)
The Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1- Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and compliance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3- Electing the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4- Appointing the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5- Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must publish the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.
<page_end>189</page_end>

## Article (21)
### Rights and Obligations of Shareholders:
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1- Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares decided for distribution.
2- Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors and attending General Assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law and these Articles of Association. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3- Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4- Disposing of his owned shares and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5- Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

## Article (22)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to the following:
1- Paying the installments due on his owned shares upon their due dates and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2- Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of his share value, and the company shall have the right to execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3- Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly.
4- Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and committing to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

## Article (23)
The General Assembly of Shareholders shall not be permitted to do the following:
1- Increasing the financial burdens of shareholders or increasing the nominal value of the share.
2- Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as stipulated in the company's Articles of Association.
3- Imposing new conditions, other than those mentioned in the Articles of Incorporation or these Articles of Association, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote at General Assemblies.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a collective vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures for amending the company's Articles of Association.

## Article (24)
### 1- Board of Directors:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.

## Article (25)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's Articles of Association may stipulate that no more than half of the first Board of Directors members shall be elected from among the company's founders.

## Article (26)
The Board of Directors shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the Articles of Association. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

## Article (27)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among its members or from outside, entrusted with managing the company. The Board shall determine his allowances and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

## Article (28)
The Board of Directors may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

## Article (29)
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint a representative to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of elected Board members. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as elected members.
The company's General Assembly shall elect one or more independent members from among the Board of Directors members who possess experience and competence, and their remuneration shall be determined according to governance rules, provided that their number does not exceed half of the Board members. It is not required for the member to be a shareholder in the company.
The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

## Article (30)
A Board of Directors meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. Decisions shall be taken by a majority or a larger number. Meetings may be held using modern communication means, and decisions may be taken by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

## Article (31)
Minutes of the Board of Directors meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary. Any member who did not approve a decision taken by the Board may record their objection in the meeting minutes.

## Article (32)
If a Board of Directors member's position becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall complete only the term of their predecessor. However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call a General Assembly of Shareholders to elect a new member within one month of the last vacancy, and it shall elect those who fill the vacant positions.

## Article (33)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for Board of Directors membership:
1- Must possess legal capacity to act.
2- Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a freedom-restricting penalty, or a crime against honor or trust, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or trust, or a freedom-restricting penalty for violating legal provisions, unless their reputation has been restored.
3- Must personally own, or the person they represent must own, a number of the company's shares. The independent Board member is exempt from this condition.
If a Board of Directors member loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease from the date of losing that condition. This shall not affect the validity of the actions and decisions taken by the participating member or in which they participated in voting.
