## Article (42)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable for compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that established the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

## Article (43)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

## Article (44)
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be made a party to the lawsuit so that compensation may be awarded to it if necessary. A shareholder may file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage, and any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

## Article (45)
b- The General Assembly:
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may invite the General Assembly to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly to meet based on a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or based on a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party. The provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> as stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

## Article (46)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly. They shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of someone they represent in matters related to a special benefit for them, or an existing dispute between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney <orig>توكيل خاص</orig> or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares contrary to what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on a petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

## Article (47)
The General Assembly meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors, or their deputy, or someone delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or someone elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

## Article (48)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in its annual meeting shall be competent to make decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1- The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2- The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.

## Article (34)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234). A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company <orig>شركة مساهمة مقفلة</orig>.

## Article (35)
The chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain a benefit for themselves or others. A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on share disposal stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, or these regulations <orig>هذا النظام</orig>.

## Article (36)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

## Article (37)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from them or to consider the operations they carried out for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (38)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders, or a higher percentage may be agreed upon. (An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a decision issued by the company's General Assembly, an independent board member may be exempted from the maximum remuneration mentioned (if the company has independent members)). The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, provided that it accurately includes a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages obtained by the Board of Directors, regardless of their nature or designation.

## Article (39)
No person with representation on the Board of Directors, or the Chairman, or a member of the Board of Directors, or a member of the executive management, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless this is by a license issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (40)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members, or the Chief Executive Officer, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, or their affiliated companies, or companies that are subject to the management of any of them, or companies that...
Decisions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total issued share capital of the company.

### Article (55)
Without prejudice to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1- Amending the company's articles of association.
2- Selling the entire project for which the company was established, or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolving the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

### Article (56)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### Article (57)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullity of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of incorporation, or these regulations, or if it is intended to harm the company's interests, and claim compensation when necessary. The nullity lawsuit shall lapse after two months from the date of the General Assembly's resolution or the shareholder's knowledge of the Board of Directors' resolution. Resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may also be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital, provided they did not approve those resolutions. The nullity lawsuit shall lapse after two months from the date of the General Assembly's resolution.

### Article (58)
For closed companies <orig>الشركات المقفلة</orig>, the company shall be jointly and severally liable for the debts of its subsidiary companies if the following conditions are met:
1- Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's funds to meet its obligations.
2- The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary company's capital that enables it to control the appointment of the majority of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or managers, or the decisions issued by the management.
3- The subsidiary company takes decisions or performs actions that target the interest of the owning and controlling company and harm the interest of the subsidiary company or its creditors, and these actions are the main reason for the subsidiary company's inability to meet its obligations. All of the above applies unless the closed company is responsible for the debts of the subsidiary company based on another reason.

### Article (59)
The company's financial year begins on the first of (January) and ends on the last of (December) of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends in December of the following financial year.

### Article (60)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may stop this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to

3- A report on any violations detected by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4- The company's financial statements.
5- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6- Discharging the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7- Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remuneration.
8- Appointing the company's auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig>, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9- Appointing the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company operates according to the provisions of Islamic Sharia) and determining the report of that board.
10- A report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles.

### Article (49)
By a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the company, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital. Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and if it is not possible to elect a new board at the same meeting, the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may decide either for the existing board to continue managing the company's affairs until a new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary management committee whose primary task shall be to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (50)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>إحدى الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some of the presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be adjourned for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued capital. The adjourned meeting shall be held without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (51)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation, or these regulations. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must re-present the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting called for the purpose of discussing the aspects of the violation.

### Article (52)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles.

### Article (53)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (54)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital.

The absence of an optional reserve allows for the granting of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the mandatory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital. Also, (1%) of the company's net profit is deducted for the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.

### Article (61)
Annually, a percentage determined by the Board of Directors, after consulting the auditor, shall be deducted from the gross profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (62)
A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الاختياري</orig> account, as proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction shall cease by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

### Article (64)
Subject to the provisions contained in the company's contract, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or the end of each financial period. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits and in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; otherwise, this distribution would affect the company's paid-up capital.

### Article (65)
Auditor:
The provisions of the articles contained in Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments, specifically Articles No. 227 to 232, shall apply.

### Article (66)
At the end of each fiscal year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and statements of profit and loss for itself and all its subsidiaries, accompanied by explanations and data as required by international accounting standards.

### Article (67)
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company:
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles No. 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (68)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as specified in the provisions of Articles No. 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (69)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Articles of Association or in these Bylaws.

### Article (70)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

### Article (71)
The founders declare the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the disposal of the company.
Second: That the in-kind shares have been valued in accordance with the provisions of the law and have been fully paid.

## Membership Application Procedures:
A signed declaration from the applicant specifying the appropriate means of communication for club correspondence and announcements, whether by email, text message via phone, or message via a social media application, provided that they commit to updating this data whenever any change occurs, whether on their own initiative or at the request of the club. Correspondence conducted through one of the aforementioned means chosen by the member shall be legally binding on them. This ruling applies to current members, whereby each of them is obliged to submit this declaration if the club requests them to update their data, provided that they are notified of this request and of the decision to revoke their membership if they fail to do so, and are replaced by the club's instructions regarding it by registered letter to their address and data recorded in the club if they have not chosen one of the aforementioned means for communication and announcements.

Article (32)
From Chapter Four / Provisions Pertaining to General Assemblies:
- In cases of force majeure, General Assembly meetings may be held via visual communication (video or any other means via the internet), provided that this is recorded in minutes prepared for this purpose. This provision does not apply to elections, which must be conducted with members present and voting in person. In all cases, voting in General Assemblies shall be public, while in elections, it shall be secret.

Article (35)
From Chapter One / Regarding Nomination for Board of Directors Membership:
- The nomination request for Board of Directors membership shall be submitted in the name of the Secretary General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig> by the candidate personally or by an agent acting on their behalf under an official power of attorney, using the form prepared for this purpose by the Club, within seven days from the opening date of nominations. It must be accompanied by endorsement requests from General Assembly members as stipulated in Article (34) of these Bylaws, provided that nominations close twenty-one days before the election date.
- The withdrawal of a nomination request shall be made using the form prepared for this purpose, by the candidate personally or by an agent acting on their behalf under an official power of attorney, at least three days before the election date.
- The Electoral Committee <orig>اللجنة الانتخابية</orig> must announce the names of candidates for Board of Directors membership on the Club's notice board twice: the first time at least fifteen days prior, and the second time at least two days prior to the election date.
- (a) In the event that the number of candidates equals the number of seats allocated for Board of Directors membership, their victory by acclamation shall be announced.
- (b) In the event that the number of candidates exceeds the absolute majority, their victory by acclamation shall be announced, and the new Board of Directors shall be formed from them, as an exception to the provision of Article (33) of these Bylaws, provided that this Board shall call for supplementary elections in accordance with the provisions of these Bylaws within three months of its formation.
- (c) In the event that the number of candidates is less than the majority of the seats allocated for Board of Directors membership, nominations shall be reopened in accordance with the provisions of these Bylaws.
- The elections mentioned in paragraphs (b) and (c) shall be conducted under the supervision of the Electoral Committee <orig>اللجنة الانتخابية</orig>.
- A person who has withdrawn their nomination request may not submit a new nomination request for the same term.

Article (42)
From Chapter Four / Board of Directors Meetings:
- The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall hold at least nine meetings per year at dates determined by the President. The Secretary General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig> shall issue invitations using the method agreed upon by the Board members, and a resolution shall be issued by the Board (WhatsApp, SMS messages, email) at least one day before the meeting date. The invitation shall be accompanied by the session's agenda, memoranda, and reports related to the topics listed on this agenda, unless the Chairman of the Board <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> deems it appropriate to postpone the distribution of any of them to the members until the time of the session.
- Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be held with members present in person or via visual communication (video or any other means via the internet), whether they are inside or outside the country, provided that this is recorded in minutes prepared for this purpose.
- Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall not be valid unless an absolute majority of its members are present. If this quorum is not met, the meeting shall be postponed to another session within three days from the date of the first meeting. Board resolutions shall be issued by a majority of the votes of those present. If votes are tied, the side on which the President <orig>الرئيس</orig> is present shall prevail, and decisions shall be ratified at that time. Voting must be public.
(Request) The date, time, place, and purpose of the meeting must be announced on the Club's notice board for three consecutive days at least seven days before the scheduled meeting date.

Article (22)
From Fourth: Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig>:
- An Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig> meeting shall be valid if attended by two-thirds of the members entitled to attend. If this quorum is not met at the scheduled time, the meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding two hours, and the meeting thereafter shall be valid with the attendance of an absolute majority of members. If the quorum is not met, the meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding one week, and the person who called the first meeting must announce the new date, time, and place of the meeting on the Club's notice board for three consecutive days. The second meeting shall be valid with the attendance of one-third of the General Assembly members. If the quorum is not met, the meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding two hours, and the meeting thereafter shall be valid with the attendance of (100) members of the General Assembly. If this quorum is not met, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be competent to make a decision on the presented matter if this matter was presented to the General Assembly at the request of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. The matter shall be considered rejected if it was presented to the General Assembly at the request of the General Assembly members. Decisions shall be issued by a majority of the attending members, with the exception of changing the Club's legal entity to a commercial company, in which case the validity of the General Assembly meeting requires the attendance of two-thirds of the members, and the decision shall be by the approval of the two-thirds who commenced the meeting.

Article (27)
From Fourth: Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig>:
- The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must display on the Club's notice board, at least fifteen days before the General Assembly meetings, the agenda items and their attachments, and a list of the names of members entitled to attend the meeting. Attendance at the meeting must be approved by the Electoral Committee <orig>اللجنة الانتخابية</orig> and signed by the Secretary General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig> and the Treasurer <orig>أمين الصندوق</orig>.
- The Club shall send to the Electoral Committee <orig>اللجنة الانتخابية</orig>, the Kuwait Olympic Committee <orig>اللجنة الأولمبية الكويتية</orig>, and the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>, at least fifteen days before the General Assembly meetings, the time, date, and place of the meeting, the agenda and its attachments, as well as a list of the names of members entitled to attend the meeting. The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> must review cases of duplication.
- The Club may notify the Authority and the Kuwait Olympic Committee <orig>اللجنة الأولمبية الكويتية</orig> of the meeting results within seven days from the date of the meeting. Attendance at General Assemblies shall be in accordance with the lists approved by the Electoral Committee <orig>اللجنة الانتخابية</orig>.

Article (29)
From Chapter Four / Provisions Pertaining to General Assemblies:
- Without prejudice to the provision of Article (32) of these Bylaws, if the General Assembly meets and force majeure circumstances prevent the completion of the agenda, the session shall be adjourned, and the meeting shall be considered ongoing, provided that it resumes within a period not exceeding fifteen days to consider the remaining topics on the agenda.
- The President <orig>الرئيس</orig> shall determine the date, time, and place of the second meeting before adjourning the session, and shall announce this on the Club's notice board. Decisions taken at the first meeting shall be considered valid and enforceable.

Article (30)
From Chapter Four / Provisions Pertaining to General Assemblies:
- Without prejudice to the provision of Article (32) of these Bylaws, if force majeure circumstances prevent the holding of a General Assembly meeting at the scheduled time, the Secretary General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig> or their deputy must, within seven days from the date it was scheduled to be held, notify each member by the means chosen by the member. This notification shall produce its legal effect against them, provided that the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> determines the date, time, and place of the meeting.

and defining its competencies with immediate and direct effect on its operations, provided that the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> presents this decision to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> of the club at the first meeting following its issuance.
Decisions issued by the Appeals Committee <orig>لجنة الاستئناف</orig> may be challenged before the National Sports Arbitration Authority <orig>الهيئة الوطنية للتحكيم الرياضي</orig>, established in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 87 of 2017 <orig>القانون 87 لسنة 2017</orig> concerning sports, within seven days from the date of issuance of this decision.

Under no circumstances may the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> issue a decision with a majority of less than one-third of all its members.
In case of necessity, the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> shall meet outside regular times at a date determined by the President <orig>الرئيس</orig> without being bound by the aforementioned dates, or within three days from the date of a request submitted to him by one-third of the Board members. The request must state the purpose of the meeting. If the President <orig>الرئيس</orig> fails to convene the meeting within the prescribed period, the applicants may set the meeting date and issue the invitation within the three days following the period prescribed for the President <orig>الرئيس</orig>, otherwise the request shall lapse.
In all cases, the invitation must specify the date, time, and place of the meeting.
The club's secretariat shall keep a register for recording the minutes of Board meetings. The minutes of each session shall be signed by its chairman and the Secretary-General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig>.

### Article (58)
Article (58) of Chapter Six / Complaints and Penalties:
The club shall provide the necessary requirements for operating electronic systems and programs, including:
1. Electronic messaging system.
2. System for all player data.
3. System for all membership data.
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall maintain a database of the club's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> membership, provided that it is notified of all amendments affecting the membership status. Attendance at General Assembly <orig>الجمعيات العمومية</orig> meetings shall be in accordance with the lists approved by the Electoral Committee <orig>اللجنة الانتخابية</orig>.

### Article (53)
Article (53) of Chapter Six / Complaints and Penalties:
- Without prejudice to the provisions of Article No. (54) of this Statute, members of the club's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> shall submit their complaints to the Secretary-General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig>, who shall present them to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> at its first meeting to decide on them within thirty days from the date of submission.
The Secretary-General <orig>أمين السر العام</orig> shall notify the complainant of the Board's decision within fifteen days from the date of its issuance by the means chosen by the complainant, and this notification shall produce its legal effect against him.

### Article (54)
Article (54) of Chapter Six / Complaints and Penalties:
- If a member of the club violates the provisions of this Statute or the club's internal regulations or any of the decisions of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or commits an act that offends any of his fellow members or members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or harms the club's reputation, or damages its interests, or damages its property and contents, the Disciplinary Committee <orig>لجنة الانضباط</orig>, after conducting a written investigation with him proving his guilt or proving his refusal to attend after being notified by the means he chose, and this notification produces its legal effect against him, may impose one of the following penalties:
1- Warning.
2- Reprimand.
3- Banning the member from entering the club for a maximum period of six months.
4- Expulsion.
The member must be notified of this decision by the means chosen by the member, and this notification shall produce its legal effect against him within seven days from the date of issuance of this decision.
This is without prejudice to the club's right to claim from the member the cost of repairing any damage he caused to the club's property and contents.
The provisions of this Article shall apply to members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, provided that the penalties imposed on them are limited to the two penalties stipulated in clauses (1, 2) of this Article.
The Statute applies to the members of the club's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> and the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. The regulation governing the work and defining the competencies of the Disciplinary Committee <orig>لجنة الانضباط</orig> shall be implemented by a decision of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> –

(Continued) Article (54) of Chapter Six / Complaints and Penalties:
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall form a Disciplinary Committee <orig>لجنة الانضباط</orig> of at least three members for the duration of its term, which is responsible for applying disciplinary rules and imposing the penalties stipulated in this Statute by forming the committee and defining its competencies with immediate and direct effect on its operations in accordance with the provisions of the regulation issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, provided that the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> presents this decision to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> of the club at the first meeting following its issuance.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall also form an Appeals Committee <orig>لجنة الاستئناف</orig> of at least three members for the duration of its term, which is responsible for hearing appeals against decisions issued by the Disciplinary Committee <orig>لجنة الانضباط</orig> in accordance with the provisions of the regulation issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to organize the work and define the competencies of the Appeals Committee <orig>لجنة الاستئناف</orig>, provided that the decision of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to form the committee is implemented.

amendments to Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016).
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice
must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for the Care and Development of
Small and Medium-sized Enterprises <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming its accreditation as a small or medium enterprise with the Fund.
In accordance with Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016)
which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents
in a public session attended by bidders or their representatives."
- This announcement serves as an invitation to attend for interested practitioners, as it is the right of
companies wishing to attend the bid opening session to coordinate with the competent committee before
the day of the session.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from
the practitioners.

### Announcement
Regarding the issuance of Purchase Request No. **9033** for the supply of solar-powered floodlights –
pole-mounted floodlights – SM downlights.
The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces the issuance of Purchase Request No. **9033** for the supply of
solar-powered floodlights – pole-mounted floodlights – SM downlights.
These documents can be obtained by visiting the website
**bids.pai.gov.kw** starting from the date of publication of this announcement.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Solar-Powered Floodlights</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender | Closing Date | Document Price | Initial Security | Preliminary Meeting |
|:------|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 2025/10/5 | 2025/10/19 | 75 K.D. | 400 K.D. | None |
</table>

The deadline for submitting bids is Sunday, **2025/10/19**, until **12:00**
PM. Bids shall be submitted at the main headquarters of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Second Floor
– Supplies and Warehouses Department – Procurement Section) in an envelope bearing the name of the
practice. Bids shall be valid for ( **90** ) days from the date of opening the bid
bids.
The practitioner must submit a 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
recently, stating that there is no suspension on the company's file regarding government contracts
registered with the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, and a 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate confirming compliance with
the national labor percentage, dated recently and contemporary to the bid date. The practitioner must also
deposit with their bid an initial security in the form of a certified check or an unconditional and irrevocable letter of guarantee
free from any reservations, issued in the name of the bidder
from one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and in favor of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
and valid for the duration of the bid. Any bid not accompanied by the full
security shall be excluded. The initial security shall not be refunded until ( **90** ) days have passed from the closing date of the
practice or when the winning practitioner signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Authority shall not
pay any interest on the amount of this security, and the practitioner may not seize
its amount, noting that this practice is divisible.

# Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>
## Announcement
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the individuals whose names are listed below have had their residential addresses deregistered (based on the homeowner's declaration or due to building demolition). These individuals must contact the Authority to register a new address or do so via the 'Sahel' <orig>سهل</orig> application (after providing supporting documents) within thirty days from this date. Failure to do so will result in the penalty stipulated in Article (33) of Law No. 32 of 1982, which is a fine not exceeding one hundred dinars, multiplied by the number of individuals.

Practice No. 02 for 2025-2026
Regarding the maintenance, warranty, and operation of NDR and XDR devices at the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>.

The Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (KDIPA <orig>هـ.ت.م</orig> 02-2025/2026) for the maintenance, warranty, and operation of NDR and XDR devices at the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>, in accordance with the technical specifications and the special and general conditions stipulated in the practice documents.

<table_caption>Tender Details for NDR and XDR Device Maintenance</table_caption>
<table>
| Offering Date | Closing Date | Price | Initial Guarantee | Preliminary Meeting | Technical Envelope Opening Date |
|:------|:--------|:------|:---|:---|:---|
| Sunday, 2025/10/5 | Thursday, 2025/10/23 at 2:00 PM | 75 K.D. (refundable) | Valid for 90 days from the date of opening technical envelopes | Tuesday, 2025/10/14 at 11:00 AM | Sunday, 2025/10/26 in a closed session |
</table>

Practice documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department, Procurement and Tenders Section, located on the 45th floor of Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig> (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> - Plot 8 - Building 14), during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 2025/10/5.
*   This practice is open to approved practitioners registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> who meet the legal conditions and qualifications to participate in these practices and submit their offers.
*   A letter of authorization in the name of the representative must be submitted for handing over practice documents, along with a personal ID, and the company's registration certificate with (the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> and the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>) when purchasing the practice booklet.
*   A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> and valid for one year, must be submitted with the purchase of the practice and the submission of the bid.
*   Bids must be deposited in the Authority's official envelope, sealed with red wax, into the practices box at the headquarters of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>, without mentioning the sender's name or any indication or mark identifying them. Bids are valid for 90 days from the date of

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the Expiry of the Preliminary Approval Period for the License Application Submitted by Cavio Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة كافيو للوساطة المالية</orig>

The Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> announces the expiry of the preliminary approval period granted to Cavio Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة كافيو للوساطة المالية</orig> on 2025/03/30, in accordance with Resolution No. (49) of 2025 regarding the license application submitted by Cavio Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة كافيو للوساطة المالية</orig> to engage in securities activities, issued on 2025/03/26.
Accordingly, the application for a license for securities activities submitted by Cavio Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة كافيو للوساطة المالية</orig> is considered null and void as of the expiry date of the preliminary approval on 2025/09/29, in accordance with the provisions of Article 1-7 of Book Five (Securities Activities and Registered Persons) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities and its amendments, which states the following:
"In the event that the applicant fails to submit the required documents and information within the period specified by the Authority in the notification, without an acceptable excuse from the Authority, the application shall be considered null and void."

Announcement

### Practice No. (30 – 2025 / 2026)
**Subject:** Practice for the Supply, Warranty, Installation, and Operation of Lighting Units
**INTERLOCK TAXIWAY LIGHTS LED**
**for Western Runway 33L/15R at Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig>**
The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. (30 – 2025 / 2026) for the supply, warranty, installation, and operation of INTERLOCK TAXIWAY LIGHTS LED lighting units for Western Runway 33L/15R at Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications mentioned in the practice documents, with adherence to scheduling appointments for government entities as per the esteemed Council of Ministers' <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> decisions. These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig> at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> starting from Sunday, 05/10/2025, during official working hours, upon payment of seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (KD 75) only, provided that payment is made via K-Net.
A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on Tuesday, 14/10/2025, at 12:00 PM.
The documents shall be returned after completion, with the required supporting documents attached, and an initial security deposit of no less than (2%) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security deposit will not be considered, even if they conform to specifications. The security deposit must be valid for the required bid validity period. The documents shall be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax, and bids will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig>) at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 01:00 PM on Tuesday, 21/10/2025, and any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

### Announcement
regarding Practice No.: (25-2025 / 2026)
Requirements of the Permits Department <orig>قسم التصاريح</orig> at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. (25-2025 / 2026) for the requirements of the Permits Department <orig>قسم التصاريح</orig> at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications mentioned in the practice documents, with adherence to scheduling appointments for government entities as per the esteemed Council of Ministers' <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> decisions. These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig> at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> starting from Sunday, 05/10/2025, during official working hours, upon payment of seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (KD 75) only, provided that payment is made via K-Net.
A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on Monday, 13/10/2025, at 11:00 AM.
The documents shall be returned after completion, with the required supporting documents attached, and an initial security deposit of no less than (2%) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security deposit will not be considered, even if they conform to specifications. The security deposit must be valid for the required bid validity period. The documents shall be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax, and bids will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig>) at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 01:00 PM on Monday, 20/10/2025, and any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

Announcement
The Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الادارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig> announces its desire to issue Practice No. (2025-2026/8) for the maintenance of microfilm equipment for the Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الادارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig>, including spare parts. The practice terms can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

General Secretariat of Endowments <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>
Announcement
Regarding the inventory and updating of data for all proven descendants entitled to endowments
The General Secretariat of Endowments <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> is pleased to invite the descendants of the endowers to inventory and update the data of all those whose entitlement is proven:
1- Waqf <orig>وقف</orig> / Mariam bint Hamdi <orig>مريم بنت حمدي</orig>, where the endowment is for (the children of Ibrahim <orig>إبراهيم</orig> and Ayoub <orig>أيوب</orig>) as stated in the deed.
Attendance at the headquarters of the General Secretariat of Endowments <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> located in Dasma <orig>الدسمة</orig> Area, Block (6), Hamoud Al-Raqaba <orig>حمود الرقبة</orig> Street, to prove their entitlement during the period from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM.
For inquiries during morning hours, please call 22065476.
Required Documents:
1- Death certificate + copy of inheritance inventory in case of death of (father / mother).
2- Original civil ID of the applicant and a copy thereof.
3- Original birth certificate of the applicant if the kinship to the endower is through the mother, and a copy thereof.
4- Original court judgment proving kinship to the endower if natural proof is not possible, and a copy thereof.
5- A letter from the bank containing the beneficiary's account number (IBAN) and name

in Arabic and English.
6- Statement of inheritance division issued by the Sharia Departments <orig>الأقسام الشرعية</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> (for deceased beneficiaries) to determine the share of each descendant from the endowment's revenue.

Announcement 109 / 2025
The holder of the following license has submitted an application to the Municipality:
<table_caption>License Holder Information</table_caption>
<table>
| Commercial Name | Innovative Construction Company for General Trading and Contracting |
|:---|:---|
| Category | Building Contractor in Category C |
| Registration Number | 2000856 |

Requests the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit an application to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation may issue its decision thereon after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen (15) days have elapsed from the date of publication of this application in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration entails the refund of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this Resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracting agreements concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Section <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.
Director General of the Municipality

Resolution No. (10) of 2020
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Resolution No. (1) of 2019
Regarding the regulation of company registration procedures

The Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
Having reviewed Law No. (1) of 2010 regarding the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
And Law No. (1) of 2019 regarding Companies,
And Resolution No. (1) of 2019 regarding the regulation of company registration procedures,
And upon the approval of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> at its meeting No. (10) of 2020 dated 15/11/2020,
And as required by the interest of work,
Has resolved:

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following text:
Article (1)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall undertake the registration of companies in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, and for that purpose, it shall have all powers stipulated for the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> in this regard.

<table>
| No. | Description                                     |
| :-- | :---------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Company Registration Application                |
| 2   | Company Memorandum of Association               |
| 3   | Company Articles of Association                 |
| 4   | Capital Deposit Certificate                     |
| 5   | Copy of Civil ID for Founders                   |
| 6   | Copy of Passport for Non-Kuwaiti Founders       |
| 7   | Bank Certificate confirming Capital Deposit     |
| 8   | Any other documents requested by the Authority  |
</table>

Article (2)
The following Article (2) shall be added to Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, with the following text:
Article (2)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall be committed to registering companies within a period not exceeding (3) working days from the date of completion of all required documents, after payment of the prescribed fees.

Article (3)
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
Sheikh Dr. / Mishaal Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>

The minutes were approved at meeting No. (108/2025) held on 24/09/2025, in accordance with the regulations of the Supreme Purchase Committee's <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> work system.

**Statement of Resolutions of the Supreme Purchase Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> No. (108/2025) held on 24/09/2025**

The Supreme Purchase Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> for tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries held its meeting at 12:30 PM on Wednesday, in Al-Ahmadi City <orig>مدينة الأحمدي</orig>, in the meeting room at the Guest House, after achieving its quorum and in the presence of the esteemed members of the Committee, the Secretariat, and representatives of the concerned parties.
Mr. Chairman <orig>السيد/ الرئيس</orig> opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then he and the esteemed members reviewed the agenda items as follows:

**Item One:**
The minutes of the Committee's previous meeting No. (107/2025) held on 23/09/2025 were approved.

**Item Two:**
The attendance of the esteemed members of the Committee for the next Committee meeting No. (109/2025) was recorded, and a legal quorum for its convening was confirmed.

Issuance of Addendum No. (2) to amend the technical qualification criteria and the award strategy for Tender Card No. (RFP-2141028) for the construction of crude oil flowlines and associated works for Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>.
The Committee reviewed the letter from Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> regarding the request. After discussion, the Committee decided to approve the issuance of Addendum No. (2) to the general specifications as follows:
1- Amendment of the mandatory technical qualification criteria (TECHNICAL CREDENTIALS) in location No. 11A of the bid form.
2- Amendment of (Special Amendments to Bidders) Item No. 19, the tender award strategy, to be as follows: "Four (4) separate contracts will be awarded under this tender based on the best price combination, provided the bid is compliant with the tender documents. No more than one contract shall be awarded to a single bidder, even if the bidder submits the lowest prices for more than one contract, and the bidder is not entitled to choose a contract among these contracts for award."
3- Deletion of Annexure III (BID) from the General Instructions to Bidders.

The Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> announces Tender No. 67-M-2025/2026 for the supply of a tree and agricultural waste shredding machine. Tender documents can be obtained from the Institute's website:

Should you wish to participate, a fee of KWD 75/- (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only) must be paid at the Cashier's Office at the Institute's headquarters in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> area. The deadline for submitting bids is Monday, 20-10-2025, at 12:00 PM.

- Furthermore, we would like to draw the attention of the esteemed bidders / companies to the fact that, based on the text of Article (29) of Law No. 49 of 2016 <orig>قانون رقم 49 لسنة 2016</orig> concerning Public Tenders <orig>المناقصات العامة</orig>, "It is not permissible for one person or a group of natural persons to register under more than one name during classification or to submit more than one bid in a tender, except for alternative bids where the tender conditions allow their submission. However, a person who has a share in separate companies, each independent with its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative apparatus, may register himself and each of his independent companies during classification. The bid of any tenderer violating this article shall be considered null and void by operation of law."
